course.subject: MGMT
course.name: Organizational Behavior
course.description: Human behavior and behavioral issues in organizations studied from the perspective of the individual and that of the organization.

reviews.author: outerspace
reviews.comment_content: Content is pretty straightforward re: leadership, behaviours, individual vs team, conflict, negotiation, motivation, norms etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Jeong is one of the best professors I've had so far - she is extremely smart, kind, teaches really well, is very understanding and helpful! Her classes are engaging and you can learn a lot from them - a really great teacher.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% Midterm (MCQ)
30% Final (Short answer questions)
30% Group project
14% Participation (answering questions in class, giving feedback for other's group projects)
6% Research participation (research surveys)
reviews.comment_workload: Not too bad, the project could drag your grade down though so work hard on it! Midterm and final are pretty easy if you understand the content and can apply it to situations.

reviews.author: rubbishstudent
reviews.title: Best prof ever !
reviews.comment_content: The contents focus on investigating the psychological and behavioural aspects of human being. Topics are interesting, for example leadership, decision making errors, emotions and moods, personalty etc. They are kind of facts which do not require much understanding.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lucia is really a great professor. She cares about students, often send out candies as gift and motivates students a lot. Her voice is nice to hear and easy to catch up. You will not find her lesson boring as she will give lots of examples, play videos etc.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is super awesome. Surprisingly, the midterm is all MC but not as easy as other professors so the mean is around 70% while other classes having 80+%. The final mean is even as low as 63% only which composed of 6 short questions and 2 pages cheatsheet is allowed. I got 1.2  SD higher in midterm, SD of final is not revealed but the mean is 19/30 and I scored 25/30. Project grade is having 80+% as mean and I scored 90%. A+ at the end.
reviews.comment_workload: 1 midterm 1 final and 1 group project. Not much instructions is given for the project. I think the key will be try your best to be presentable anf fluent in the presentation, engage your audience as much as possible. You have to use your free time to discuss the project with your grpmates.

reviews.author: iwantgoodgrade
reviews.title: Interesting course
reviews.comment_content:
The content of this course is more about human psychology. The content is interesting and well discussed from different perspectives.
Topic outline FYI
Part I: Introduction
Class 01: Course introduction
Class 02: What is Organizational Behavior? (Ch. 1)

Part II: The Individual
Class 03: Personality and Individual Differences (Ch. 4)
Class 04: Values, Attitude, and Behavior (Ch. 3, 4)
Class 05: Emotion (Ch. 3, 6)
Class 06: Perception and Learning in Organization I (Ch. 5)
Class 06: Perception and Learning in Organization I (Ch. 5)
Class 07: Employee Motivation I (Ch. 7, 8)
Class 08: Employee Motivation II (Ch. 7, 8)
Class 09: Judgment and Decision Making I (Ch. 5)
Class 10: Judgment and Decision Making II (Ch. 5)
Class 11: Team Dynamics (Ch. 9, 10)
Class 12: Communication (Ch. 12)
Class 13: Power and Influence in Workplace (Ch.
Class 14: Conflict and Negotiation (Ch. 18)
Class 15: Leadership I (Ch. 13)
Class 16: Leadership II (Ch. 13)
reviews.comment_teaching: He likes making jokes and making the lesson more interactive. He often uses different examples to explain. No textbook is needed.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term Online real-time assignment 20%
Final Online real-time assignment 24%
Group Project 25% (10% for presentation, 10% for written report, and 5% for peer
evaluation)
Participations 20 % (10% contribution to class, 10 % class assignment)
Attendance on Student Presentations 5%
Research 6%

Midterm: 22.5/30
Final: 77.25/100
Group project: 18/20
Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Only group project mainly. NO assignment!!!
The group project will in a format like this
Your oral presentation and written report should include:
Introduction:  Briefly describe the real-life  OB  problem being addressed.  State the objectives of your
project.
About the interviewee/organization: Provide relevant background information about your interviewee
and/or the organization involved, e.g. demographics, job duties, nature of business.
The real-life  OB  problem:  Describe in detail the real-life  OB  problem being addressed,  e.g.  How does
the problem arise? What are the adverse impacts on employees and organizations?
Recommended solutions: Describe and justify your recommendations. Discuss the potential obstacles
when following your recommendations and the ways to deal with those obstacles.  
Conclusion: Provide a summary of the main points presented in your presentation/report.

reviews.author: Soberzz
reviews.comment_content: All about organisational behaviour
reviews.comment_teaching:
BadBadBad
You are required to do recap on his last lecture, as well as interesting findings on each chapter. Half of your lectures will not be teaching any stuffs. But luckily, he got all things done before the course ended.
reviews.comment_grading:
Surprisingly good
Even my two exams are slightly above mean and slightly below mean respectively, but it turns out to be a B+. Group work and participation should have saved me from C range.
reviews.comment_workload: Your workload would be those recap and interesting findings, as well as group project. Not very heavy, but very troublesome, cooperating with your teammates would be helpful.

reviews.author: lonelyguy
reviews.comment_content:
This course will help by covering a wide variety of OB topics.
Week 1: Introduction
Week 1-2: Emotions & Moods
Week 3: Personality and Values
Week 4: Perception and Decision Making
Week 5: Motivation
Week 6: Mid-Term Exam
Week 7: Communication
Week 8: Leadership & Power
Week 9: Conflict & Negotiation  
Week 10: Presentation Preparation
Week 11-13: Presentation
reviews.comment_teaching:
She is super nice and friendly. Lucia loves interacting with students in class and sometimes will give us some snacks as well! Her lessons are not boring for me, but some of my classmates think that the lessons are a bit boring.

She also ends the lessons early so it is really good!

Also, her grading system is very transparent, especially for the class participation. You really earn your grade base on the efforts that you put on this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Her midterm exam was super hard since time allowed was not enough (60 mins with 56 MCs omg) and she asked very detailed questions. Even though you had cheat sheet (or reference sheet as she said), you would probably still miss some details.

Grading Components:
20% Exam 1: 44/56 (Mean: 42.6, SD: 6)
30% Exam 2: 24.5/30 (Mean: 19.4)
30% Project: 22.2/30 (Mean: 23.8)
14% Class Participation: 13.85/14
6% Research: 6/6

Final Grade: A-
Omg! It is really super a good grade since I screwed up my midterm exam and my project. I thought I cannot get an A-range in this subject!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too much workload. But, there are iPRS after teaching every chapter so do attend those lessons or else you will lose your participation mark. Also, she will ONLY take attendance during the presentation day. So, you can choose not to attend her lessons, but some key points are blurred in her powerpoints. If you do not attend the lesson, you may not know the answers.

Project: 1 progress report only and does not count towards the grade. Presentation day is decided by lucky draw. My group was presented in the 1st week which was the same date of handing the report. So, our workload was super high.

reviews.author: llinaw
reviews.title: Interesting Course and Nice Professor
reviews.comment_content:
- Introduction
- What is Organizational Behaviour?
- Personality
- Value and Attitude
- Emotion
- Perception and Learning
- Motivation
- Decision Making
- Team Dynamics
- Communication
- Power
- Conflict and Negotiation
- Leadership

Textbook is not required, though Ellick suggests all of us should have a physical copy, he says that we will benefit a lot from reading it.
I think some contents are quite interesting.
Even though most seem to be common sense, Ellick says there are some differences and we need to differentiate ourselves from those who are not taking this course.
It will probably be the first time to do a group project based on evidence. I think it is quite interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think Ellick is a really nice professor, who tries his best to make the lectures interesting.
He is really patient in explaining and answering students' questions related to the group project.
He is Hongkonger so he sometimes makes some jokes like "blowing water" 吹水
He gives "future paper of the final exam" (questions that many of us get wrong in the midterm exam) and explains them during the lectures.
Due to the typhoon, we miss one class but Ellick has a made-up class to help us prepare for the final exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
- Mid-term Exam 25%
- Final Exam 25%
- Group Project 25% (10% for presentation, 10% for written report, and 5% for peer evaluation)
- Participations 14 % (10% contribution to class, 10 % class assignment)
- Attendance on Student Presentations 5%
- Research 6%

- Mid-term Exam (I forget the exact score, but it was below the mean)
- Final Exam: 13.708/25
(Mean: 13.2, Low: 0.0, High: 21.7)
- Final Group Project Score: 21.25/25
(Mean: 20.3, Low: 16.3, High: 21.9)
- Final Grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Overall, I think the workload is relatively low.

- Participation/Attendance:
    - Attendance will not be taken during lectures but will be taken when it comes to presentations.
    - There will be some class assignment which is pretty easy; answering a few questions.

- Midterm Exam:
    - Midterm exam is closed-book
    - It consists of 60 MCs
    - Ellick says if our average score in the midterm exam is above 75%, then our final exam will not be cumulative.

- Final Exam:
    - Since our average score in the midterm exam is below 75%, our final exam is cumulative.
    - It is an open-book exam.
    - The final exam consists of 4 parts:
        - Part 1: 4 Short questions (questions that many of us get wrong in the midterm)
            - Ellick changes some details and the format of the questions.
            - You need to fully understand the logic behind when he gives the "future paper" during the lectures.
            - He may ask why you should do this action or what if the situation is... etc.. in the final exam.
        - Peer evaluation
            - Rate each of your groupmates on a scale of 0-10.
        - Part 1.5
            - We watch a video of Ellick explaining what is part 1.5 lol
            - There are 3 questions that free riders will not be able to answer (What is the independent variable/dependent variable/contingency factor mentioned in the assigned research paper?)
            - The number of questions you get correct determines the percentage of your score you get in part 2 (for example, if you get 1 question correct, then you will get 33.33% of the score you get in part 2)
        - Part 2: 3 Long questions
            - There are questions related to the problems encountered during the group project or solutions you would like to suggest.
            - There will be 4 areas, and each area contains 2 OB topics. You need to choose 2 areas.
            - You need to answer the questions according to the 2 areas chosen.

- Group Project:
    - Most workload of this course will be the group project.
    - Around 8-9 people per group. I think this number of people is quite a lot and according to what is taught in this course (more people in a group, less motivation to work because you expect others will work), you must expect there are some free-riders in your group.
    - I suggest attending the consultation session because Ellick explains what he expects us to do in the group project more thoroughly.
    - You are expected to define the iv (independent variable), dv (dependent variable) and contingency factor, give an introduction of the assigned research paper and come up with a solution (which is also the iv) based on the evidence suggested by the research paper. Remember all the things need to be supported by evidence from the research paper.

- Research:
    - There are 3 online research studies posted on Canvas. Each consists of 4 parts and takes around 1 hour to complete. Just answering some questions.
    - Remember to finish all to get full credit for the research participation.

reviews.author: cancan
reviews.title: Best MGMT Professor in UST (no cap), defo reg her
reviews.comment_content:
Straightforward and easy content. Nothing out of the ordinary and you should be able to understand the content with ease by looking at the lecture notes. (Refer to Syllabus below)


Personality and Values
Perception and Learning I&II
Individual Decision Making & Case Exercise
Emotions and Job Attitudes
Emotional Labor & Emotional Intelligence & Stress
Motivation I&II
Team Dynamics I
Team Dynamics II
Communication
Negotiation & Conflict Management
Leadership, Power & Influence I
Leadership, Power & Influence II
reviews.comment_teaching:
Her teaching is excellent, you probably won't see a professor who is as good at teaching MGMT as her. I couldn't wait to have her lectures every time. She engages with the students very well by often asking open-ended questions and encouraging us to speak up since she really listens to us and there's no correct answer anyway. She's also very friendly and warm which makes it pleasant for us to hear her speak. The pace of teaching is appropriate (to me) so you won't feel like some parts are a waste of time.

MGMT is supposed to be boring in general but she plays a lot of relevant videos (especially real-life experiments) which are quite interesting and helps us understand the concepts very well ( some Qs in the MT are related to the videos too so better pay attention :) ).

She also occasionally sets up case exercises (I won't spoil them or it won't be fun for you) and in-class discussions for some topics which have case studies, which are quite entertaining and engaging too so I can almost guarantee you that you won't get bored from attending her lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Examination I 20%
Examination II 30%
Team project 30%
Class participation 14%
Research participation 6%
Total 100%


Quite fair, but if you're introverted then you might have to work harder to make up for it since the participation mark is relatively high compared to other courses. But I highly recommend you to speak up since that's just the only criterion to get the mark (as long as you type what you said in class in the discussion board for each class, which will be closed b4 next class)

The MT is MC and the Final is Essay. Strongly suggest you to make your own notes so that you'll save loads of time during the exams.
MT: Mean:58/63; SD, 9.1
Final: N/A

For the team project ( basically choose a movie and discuss the OB issues involved), just make sure you have great groupmates and report free-riders. I was kinda bummed since out of the 5 group members, only me and one other group member was kinda engaged in it so it's a little bit hard for me to work well on it. In this sem, the prof forms the group for us, so good luck! And make sure you choose a movie most groupmates have watched so it'll be easier to discuss the OB issues.

The research credit is easy to obtain, just remember to read the email. But I couldn't take part in the first research study as I needed the names of 2 real-life managers, instead the alternate research study is a 4-5 page reflection on a reading.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite manageable, apart from preparing for class by doing the readings a few times. But it might be a bit too overwhelming in April since you have to complete the final report and the presentation for the chosen movie before the last week of April.

Then he uses around 15 mins to teach the main topic. To be honest, I think this teaching style is still acceptable for me because I can simply hea for the whole lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
If you want to have good grade only, reg him! If you care more about what you will learn in the course, dun reg him.

Be active during lesson and going back for f2f lesson are the keys of getting good grade from this professor. (I tried to be more active and I went back for some f2f lessons as well). Only the first exam score released (around 0.8 sd above mean), other score were not disclosed and I got A finally.
reviews.comment_workload:
This course shouldn't be a heavy workload course but the professor increases quite a lot.

First, we need to prepare interesting findings and recap every lesson (group basis), but actually only spend you around 30 minutes outside the lesson for that.

Second, the group project is quite demanding but luckily we got 9 groupmates and we could evenly distributed the workload.

Third, in my opinion, exam has the heaviest workload. Since he didn't spend enough time on explaining concepts as well as not providing any lecture recording back (his PowerPoint slides are too simplify as well), I need to read the WHOLE textbook and search online myself, which uses a lot of time. This is the first course in ust that I have to read the whole textbook!

And he never gives practice questions/ papers for his exam. More than half of the lesson is students sharing their own views and sometimes irrelevant things while only small half of the lesson is about something that is going to appear in the examinations.
reviews.comment_grading: The grades aren't released yet but I don't feel that it would be good. He only releases the results of the mid-term exam right before the study break of the finals.
reviews.comment_workload: Actually, the workload isn't big if you are not planning to rush for sharing on every lesson for participation. And group project would depend on your groupmates but I think it is a bit higher than the other courses

However, in this special semester (Fall 2019, Hong Kong Protest, in case u don't know just search on web), classes from mid-Nov. onwards were cancelled. Hence, the lectures cover only from individual to group context, skipping the rest of organization part.
reviews.comment_teaching:
This Professor taught in a quite funny way, and gave adequate example whereas necessary. The only downside is that he sometime speaks too long (though he speaks fast) and could not finish such sub-topic within the schedule.

Btw, he sometimes speaks in quit HongKongly style such that international students might have difficulties in understanding some of the examples, but this should not have a big impact on understanding the lecture materials.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Lucia is an extremely pretty and cheerful professor. She always gives out Kisses (chocolate) to us! She likes to ask questions in class so class is interactive. However, I feel like she reads from the powerpoint quite a lot of times.

I like that Lucia does not give out class participation mark by how much questions or answers you ask/answer in class. All class participation marks can be obtained by attending her game sessions and iPRS miniquizzes (super super easy). And, she even tells you when you can get these points in the timetable she released at the beginning of the course. But you have the responsibility to check the timetable as she won't remind you which classes have marks.

However, you will definitely have advantage if you answer questions in class, as Lucia will remember you and that will give you a HUGE advantage during group project and presentation.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 20%, MC
Final 30%, Essay
Team project 30%
Class participation 14%
Research participation 6%

although class content is easy, the midterm was quite tricky and grade statistics weren't that outstanding

final was on short questions (6 short essays, one page max) on respective topics

team project is on a movie analysis, where you have to analyse movie content and characters based on the OB concepts taught throughout the semester

class participation can be taken be attending class on time (iPRS before class every two lessons on a OB concept, really easy and you can discuss in class so almost everyone gets full marks)

research participation details will be sent via email, so don't worry about this as you will get all 6% by attending two management experiments/surveys organised by the department
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is super light. The quizzes are so easy you can just read the powerpoint slides 5-10 minutes before class and still score full mark. The group project was tough for me as my group mates were all either free-riders (you can't choose your own group mates), or gave really low quality work. So I almost had to do the entire project on my own which was tough as I deadline-fought.

If you manage your time well, things should be quite easy to finish in a short amount of time as the OB concepts are easy to "blow-water" from the movie.

The project includes a mid-project short paper (2 pages, not graded), a group presentation and a final report (forgot how many pages, but much longer than mid-project paper)

reviews.comment_teaching: I love Lucia so much!!!!! One of the best professors that I've met in UST. Perfect English and great teaching. Some sense of humor too.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm (20%, MCQ only)
Final (30%, Essay only)
Group Project (30%, Report and Presentation)
Class Participation (14%)
Research Participation (6%)

Midterm is very easy if you have a good cheatsheet. (Lucia calls it a reference sheet, not a cheatsheet.) Just put every single thing in the lecture notes on the cheatsheet. Then getting above 1 sd should be super easy. The mean was pretty high, 46/60, and the sd was around 6. I got 56/60, which was about 1.7 sd above.

I felt the final exam was pretty hard because all the questions were essay-type questions. You can't solve them easily unless you perfectly understand the concepts and their applications. It is unlike midterm. Actually the cheatsheet was useless.

The group project is identifying OB concepts from movies and relating them to real applications. 5-6 people per group. I think all the groups got similar scores... so getting high scores on midterm and final is important. Of course, group project is important too as it accounts for 30% of the total grade.

For class & research participation, just make sure to go to the lectures and 3 research sessions.

Final and project grades unknown.
Final grade = A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload I think...? Concepts are easy, so you can understand almost everything if you attend lectures.
Just put some effort on the group project.

reviews.author: Ovaltine
reviews.title: Good mgmt course
reviews.comment_content:
The content of the OB course covers mainly individual behavioral and group behavioral theories.  The course includes a quite a lot of theory and concepts that might be hard to remember, especially when revising for exams but overall is quite interesting.  

At the end of the semester there is a group presentation project that is very important for your final grade, here students have to combine what they have learnt in class and apply it to a movie of choice.  The group project consists of 2 tasks

1. Design a OB hypothesis and experiment to test it
2. Identify OB issues in a movie and provide a solution to it
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Martha is one of the best professors in ust.  She speaks very clearly and is always available if students are ever confused or need clarification.  She actively engages with the class and encourages many students to participate and earn points for the grading.  In this class even many introverts are not shy to speak up since Martha gives many opportunities to talk.  She is clearly very passionate in teaching this course and many students enjoy her classes.

The TA is also very helpful and open in clarifying any admin issues or confusion.  Martha even surprised her with a birthday cake in one of her lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading for this course is really fair and assesses you over different areas.  

Midterm (20%)
MCQ paper consisting of 55 questions done in around 1.5 hours

Final (30%)
Short answer questions out of 92 marks, some of her questions are a bit confusing and difficult.  Our paper had a question on "Should universities embrace or reject chatgpt" which many students found challenging to apply the OB issues

Group project (30%)
This is very important as it could make or break your grade.  A good group really makes a big difference.

Participation (14%)
Answer questions in class, do extra hw tasks and quizzes.

Academic research (6%)
Complete some behavioral tasks as lab rats for hkust

My grades
Midterm 52/55 (mean 43, SD around 10)
Final 87/92 (mean 81, SD around 10)
Progress report 10/10
Final report 45/45
Presentation 46/50

Academic research 6/6 and unknown participation

Overall A
reviews.comment_workload: The workload can be a bit challenging towards the group project as you have to balance out studying for finals too.  Our presentation was not the best we could do because each group member had many other exams to study for, and the content may take a bit of time to revise but overall not bad.

reviews.comment_workload: The overall workload of the course was comfortable and manageable. Nothing that gave any feeling of undue or unnecessary stress.

reviews.author: Jonybear
reviews.title: A range if you treat it right
reviews.comment_content:
Organizational Behaviour looks at a simplified model of how different levels of a organization behaves and reacts to external and internal stimuli, providing insight into problems and biases that are common at a organizational, group, individual level.

The content is considered useful if one has certain interest in its applications, but if you just want to pass the course, just make sure you understand all the concepts in the powerpoints and how they relate to each other in terms of recency, accuracy, and other limitations.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Melody is a good teacher who answers questions clearly and provides adequate amounts of detailed explanation of concepts through her presentations and lectures.

listening to lectures = looking at ppt + wikipedia search, so up to you whether you want to listen close during lectures

however attending lectures is important because participation is graded
reviews.comment_grading:
I got A+, and I believe that if you focus a adequate amount of time on understanding the concepts you will definitely get A range.

It is a conceptually simple course. I would say wikipedia can teach you all you need to know regarding each concept if you have trouble

I think the grade range is dragged low because most students in this class are not that interested in the topic and treat it as a “水课”
reviews.comment_workload:
midterm exam
final exam
final group research paper + presentation

the midterm is just understanding the concepts taught and recalling them
the final is how to apply the concepts to certain situations, which is slightly more tricky

the presentation and research paper is very open and gives you a lot of freedom for choosing a topic, but you deal with the usual issues of group mates not doing their parts and stuff.

reviews.author: hellooo123
reviews.title: an interesting course with the best professor ever
reviews.comment_content:
An introductory course to organizational behavior, which is to investigate the impact of individuals, groups have on human behaviours within organizations in order to improve organizational effectiveness.

Topic 1 What's Organizational Behavior
Topic 2 Personality and Values
Topic 3 Emotion
Topic 4 Perception and Decision Making
Topic 5 Motivation
Topic 6 Group and Teams
Topic 7 Communication
Topic 8 Leadership

reviews.comment_teaching: Carmen is a really nice professor. Her teaching is quite interesting and has a very good accent, at least I am able to pay attention in class and understand everything without feeling tedious or sleepy. She will chat with students before and after class just like a friend and is always willing to address your issues.
reviews.comment_grading:
Carmen gives 25% A range overall.

Class Participation 14%
Examination 1  25%
Examination 2   25%
Team Project (Written Report, Presentation, & Peer Evaluation) 30%
Research Participation  6%

Exam 1: 35/39 (Mean = 32.58  S.D. = 3.35)
Exam 2: 38/40 (Mean = 32.60  S.D. = 3.84)
Project: 92/100 (Mean = 84.06  S.D. = 5.27)

I missed 4 lectures after the add-drop period and participated 3/4 times during lessons.

Final grade: A+

For both examinations, I rewatched all the recorded lecture videos.  Questions are not difficult at all, for MCQs, you can get all answers from your lecture notes. There are 3 essay questions so make sure you write fast, understand everything from the ppt and you will have good grades in your exams. However, doesn't matter if you do not do well in the exams. Participate more in class cause it really saves your grade.

For the project, it doesn't have a challenging topic but definitely needs some effort in order to score high. Follow the project guidelines and seek help from the professor whenever you are confused.
reviews.comment_workload:
I won't say this course has a light workload, but definitely not taking you a lot of time in order to have good grades. Both examinations are open book, you just have to understand the ppt then it will be fine.

The project is about evaluating ob issues and giving suggestions from a movie that your team chooses. Carmen provides in-class project consultations for us to check on our progress and you can ask her anything during the session. She will try her best to help you and guide you. Definitely not a tough course to complete.

reviews.author: here
reviews.title: Very nice prof
reviews.comment_content:
OB theories are quite interesting.
Learning how group and individuals perform and why they are doing much things.
You would be interested in this if you like observing people's behaviors and knowing the reasons behind behaviors that you can easily observe in daily life.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Carmen is a very nice prof who is very friendly and kind.
She is probably the best professor that I have never met in UST.

reviews.comment_grading:
Nice grading but mean is always high.
But I got A- with group project > mean about 1.5 SD, MT below mean 1 mark, FInal high than mean 3 marks (0.6 SD). I participated all lessons and answered questions for 1-2 times.

Attendance is needed by doing in-class exercise. You'd better answer questions for participation points.

Group project is easy to do. You just have to watch a movie and write report then do presentation. Nothing hard or difficult. Just describe the movie and analyse the movie with OB theories.

For exam, it is fully open book that you can just print out all the notes and lecture slides for your own reference in the exams. There are MCs and essay questions (not very long one) BTW she might ask you to write down your own experience for some OB theories and explain why it happens, you'd better brainstorm more before you sit for the exams.

You will have consultation for project. You can first have a draft of what you are going to do before consultation. Then you can ask for her opinions. We asked Carmen to comment on our ideas and points and she approved all the points we had and recommended us to cut some of them or it might exceed the page limit. Carmen is a professor who would give you a lot of useful and concrete advice on your group project and I think that's the reason why we are having high marks. She will tell you this one you should do and that one you should not do. We worked according to her comments and get high marks.
reviews.comment_workload: Low workload. Only group project final and MT. No HW or quizzes.

reviews.author: DJ DEER
reviews.title: Inspiring Professor + Good Grading
reviews.comment_content:
TEXTBOOK: Robbins, S.P. & Judge, T.A. 2019. Organizational Behavior (Global Edition: 18th Edition). Pearson. (2 copies are available in HKUST library reserve for 3 day loan)

SYLLUBUS:
1 Sept 1     Welcome! Course Introduction
2 Sept 6 What is Organizational Behavior (OB)?
Sept 8 Attitude and Job Satisfaction
3 Sept 13 Personality and Values
Sept 15 Emotions, Moods and OB
4 Sept 20 Perception and Decision Making (I)
Sept 22 Perception and Decision Making (II)
5 Sept 27 Motivation (I)
Sept 29 Motivation (II)
6 Oct 4 Chung Yeung Festival (no class)
Oct 6 Group Feedback Session (I)
7 Oct 11 Group Feedback Session (II)
Oct 13 Mid-term exam
8 Oct 18 Group & Teams (I)
Oct 20 Group & Teams (II)
9 Oct 25 Group project consultation (I)
Oct 27 Group project consultation (II)
10 Nov 1 Effective Communication
Nov 3 Conflict & Negotiation (I)
11 Nov 8 Professionalism and business Ethics in the workplace
Nov 10 Power & Politics
12 Nov 15 Leadership (I)
Nov 17 Ethical Leadership (II)
13 Nov 22 Group Project Presentations (a)
Nov 24 Group Project Presentations (b)
14 Nov 29 Group Project Presentations (c)

COMMENTS:
The textbook is comprehensive and the lecture is like a outline and extension of textbook related to professor's experience
reviews.comment_teaching:
Inspiring teaching style
Experienced Professor as a business man
reviews.comment_grading:
▶︎ASSESSMENT COMPONENTS:
●Class Participation 14%
●Individual Assignment 1 (Midterm Exam) 25%
●Individual Assignment 2 (Final Exam) 25%
●Team Project (Presentation + Written Report) 30%
●Research Participation 6%

▶︎COMMENTS:
●Class Participation: try to read the textbook before the class and answer the professor's question.
●Individual Assignment 1&2: OPEN BOOK EXAM. although the exams are claimed to cover the textbook, but it actually just cover the slides. But since the contents on the slides are very brief, you are advised to read the part on both textbook and slide to be safe. You DO NOT need to read the textbook content that is not on the slides for time-saving. Since it is a open book exam, organizing a  cheatsheet with adequate length and good user friendliness is important.
●Team Project: Highly dependent on your teammates. If you want to get a high grade, you are advised to supervise and finalize the project by yourself. In the case of mine, I do most of the job and overhaul all of the unqualified parts.
●Research Participation: 3 research participation, make sure you don't miss them.
●Overall: The grading is generally goods in terms of the distribution. I got A for your reference.
reviews.comment_workload:
▶︎COMMENTS:
●Individual Assignment 1&2: to prepare this assessment, the most time-consuming part is textbook reading and cheatsheet making
●Team Project: Highly dependent on your teammates. The workload might be extremely large if you do not have a capable teammate
●Research Participation: 3 hours in total
●Overall: High to me personally

reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. Can get an ok score without studying hard ( probably have something to do with the fact that we can take the exam with open notes)

reviews.author: hw1
reviews.comment_content:
Content is genuinely interesting and you can see yourself using what you were taught in this class in the future and in work. Simple things like team conflict and dynamics are taught in detail in this course, and it can really become useful when you start to actually work in the workplace and face issues in a team.

This is an introductory course to organizational behavior (OB) – the field of study that investigates how
individuals,  groups,  and  organizational  characteristics  affect  human  behaviors  and  organizational  
effectiveness.  

We live in an organizational world.  To succeed in your careers and to help your organizations succeed,
you have to understand how employees and managers behave and why they behave the way they do.  
This  course  will  help  by  covering  a  wide  variety  of  OB  topics  such  as  personality,  perception  and  
decision making, motivation, team dynamics, leadership, and power and influence.  While this course
will not turn you into OB experts right away, it should lay a good foundation to help you become more
effective and satisfied organizational members.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Jeong is a very nice person with a kind attitude and a teaching that tells you that she is genuine, interesting in teaching university students, and is passionate about her work.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair, and expect to get an A if you study just a little more than average, and put in a little effort to take notes in class and to what the Professor teaches. I got an A even without much participation and a lack of effort throughout our whole team in the Group Project (completed it in under 5 hours, somewhat like a high school project).

Midterm: 20%
Final: 30%
Team project: 30%
Class participation: 14%
Research participation: 6%
reviews.comment_workload: As I said, it is easy to get an A in this course, and thus the workload is not high, and I would say it is one of the lowest in HKUST. Midterm and Final exam is very easy if you just pay attention in lectures. You don't need much time to do self-studying. For the project, her grading is not strict at all, we submitted and presented a half-assed project. But voila, it almost score the maximum we could get in the project. For the attendance part, you just need to speak out once in class, every class, and you get the participation point. But turned out many like me didn't even take the chance to get the easiest grades ever, but still I got a good final letter grade.

reviews.author: procrastinator
reviews.comment_content:
Personality and Values
Perception and Learning
Individual Decision Making
Emotions and Job Attitudes
Emotional Labor & Emotional Intelligence & Stress
Motivation
Team Dynamics
Communication & Conflict Management
Negotiation
Leadership, Power & Influence

The topics are very simple and extremely easy to understand. There are readings assigned (just textbook chapters) but they aren't really necessary, you get a pretty good understanding of every topic just from her presentation slides. The group project was a nice and interesting concept (taking a movie/tv show and applying OB concepts to it) and it was definitely my favourite group project to have worked on.
reviews.comment_teaching: Martha is definitely my favourite professor, she is very nice and engaging and super encouraging (in terms of having students answer questions). She makes classes very interesting with activities, videos and general discussions. She also gives a lot of opportunities to students to participate (because there are often students that want to participate multiple times during each lecture even though they only count participation once per lecture), so she deliberately picks students that may not have spoken yet. I definitely left the class feeling excited for the next :)
reviews.comment_grading:
Exam I (Midterm, MCQ) 20% - 60/70, Mean 59.7 SD 7.1
Exam II (Final, Short Essay Questions) 30% - 75/75, Mean 64.9 SD 9.2
Team Project 30% - Progress Report 8/10, Final Report 40/45, Presentation 44/50 and Peer Evaluation
Class Participation 14%
Research Participation 6% - 3/3

Overall Grade - A-

Both the midterm and final exams were open-book exams, if you revise using the presentation slides (which is what I did) it is more than enough to give you a clear overview and good understanding of the concepts and content in the course. Class participation was actually tracked (she has you write down in a discussion after each class what you said during each lecture) so make sure you make an effort to participate! The group project includes two reports and a presentation. The format of the report is given. The presentation would contain content from your final report but you would want it to be very creative, engaging and interesting for people to listen to if you want a higher score.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload isn't too heavy because the whole course is formatted in a progressive manner. There are a few assignments (some required, some optional) throughout the course for credit (they're super simple and short quizzes or writing tasks). Optional assignments give you extra credit. The group project really depends on your team (it's luck because it's assigned). Different friends of mine had varied approaches when it came to the project (most commonly they split a group of 6 into three teams of 2 to work on one OB issue), but my group all worked on every OB issue together based on the formatting for the report. If you work progressively throughout the semester, the workload is manageable.

reviews.author: Ringo_gt
reviews.comment_content:
Mostly following the textbook(Robbins, S.P. & Judge, T.A. 2019. Organizational Behavior (Global Edition: 18th Edition). Pearson.

All class meetings, disregarding whether it is conducted via Zoom. In addition, students will form groups and perform group-based exercises regularly. Prior to attending classes, students are encouraged to be well prepared by reading the textbook as well as completing the assigned tasks (both group and individual).

A recap of the previous lecture is required before the actual teaching.

No final and midterm but you will have two quizzes so-called individual assignments which are similar to midterm and final.

The team project and presentation are included.
reviews.comment_teaching:
It is pretty hard to judge the teaching style of Professor Chan. People who want to hear stories will never get bored.

His accent is excellent, and his speed is slow enough for most people.

Making notes is highly recommended because most of the questions in the quiz are exactly the same as the cases he discussed in the lesson.

The recap section before every lesson is definitely a disaster. The purpose of this section is great, but most groups want to present, and the professor always allows all groups to present, which usually takes half the lecture, sometimes an hour.

reviews.author: alyssaaa
reviews.title: Prof Carmen is nice!!
reviews.comment_content:
The content being caught in this course includes some basic concepts and introductory knowledge about management.

Course content:
- Organisational behaviour
- Personality and Values
- Emotions
- Perception and Decision Making
- Motivation
- Groups and Teams
- Communication
- Leadership
- Managing Globally

Personally I find the content in the Slides quite interesting and pretty easy-to-understand. reviews.comment_teaching: Carmen is a very nice professor!! She has a strong hk accent when she spoke in English but she explains the content clearly, and she welcomes her students to ask questions whenever they don't understand. She is always fun in class!! She tries to joke sometimes. There are also breakout room discussions (in random groups for each lesson) and each group has to submit a file on Canvas at the end of the class. We will sometimes watch videos together that makes the class less boring. Overall I like her teaching style!
reviews.comment_grading:
Components:
Class Participation 14%
Midterm Exam (MCQ) 20%
Final Exam (Short essay) 30%
Project (Presentation + Written Report) 30%
Research Participation 6%

For the participation part, try to answer more questions just like the other MGMT courses. (Though I did not answer any questions) Do remember to do the research surveys else you will lose points.

For the project part, my group worked hard but the other groups are much better, we got 2-3 points below mean:((( It is about a movie related to Organisational Behaviour. You just have to analyse the movie and then write about the related OB issues - not that hard to handle, but sadly we did not manage to score a better mark.

There is 1 midterm and 1 final exam, for the midterm all of them are Multiple Choice questions, that you have to understand the concepts clearly before the exam; but in the final they are all in the form of long questions, you have to type it out in a Word Document and submit it on Canvas. The grading is not that bad though, I got a B+.
reviews.comment_workload: I would say that the workload is fine, not that heavy compared to other business foundation courses. It will be a bit busy when you have to work on the project as you will have to prepare for both the presentation and the written report, but as long as you have good groupmates who won't freeride you, I think you will be perfectly fine. And you just have to revise on the midterm and final exam just a week or so before by going through the slides. Add oil guys!!

reviews.comment_teaching: I've heard that this is the first time for this professor to teach UG students, thus his teaching really depends on what he would like to say at the moment. This make his class super interesting as it full of his own experience. However, how should you prepare for the exam should be confusing. My suggestion is that take as much notes as you can while having the class and get every concept clear before the exam. This will help you come through the exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
Super good grading.

Just type as fast as you can and participate in every section of the class and you will get a pretty good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: It depends on your teammates. As there are also many tasks each week (eg. recap, interesting findings, case studies) apart from the final group project, having a good team is really important.

reviews.author: syut3
reviews.title: LOVE THIS COURSE
reviews.comment_content: This is a fun and interesting course. It mainly talks about different human behaviours and how we can manage people according to their nature. Lots of researches are used to support the point of view of this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: CARMEN IS AWESOME! She is a nice and friendly lecturer who could remember her students' name. Much more, she always lights up the class atmosphere. I really like her <3
reviews.comment_grading: The grading of this course is fair or even good for me. As long as you focus on the lectures and participate in the class, you must be able to perform fine in the midterm and final.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy for me. All we need is to work on a group project about various organizational behaviour topics as well as give a presentation about it afterwards. But finding good teammates is really important :)

reviews.author: stephenau3
reviews.title: Good Grading, Nice professor
reviews.comment_content:
The content of the course is mainly about organisation behaviour in the individual and the group. Both parts are easy to understand if you follow the PowerPoint and engage in the course activities.
The content is pretty straight forward and clear.
Ch.1 What is OB
Ch.2 Personality and Values
Ch.3 Emotion
Ch.4 Perception and Decision Making
Ch.5 Motivation
Ch.6 Group and Teams
Ch.7 Communication
Ch.8 Leadership
Ch.9 Conflict and Motivation
Ch.10 Managing Globally
reviews.comment_teaching:
Carmen is a interesting professor who always interact with students frequently. She will not only follow the PowerPoint but add some personal example to explain the phenomenon or concepts.
The activities are fun and help us to understand the core concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 25%
Final 25%
Class Participation 14%
Research Credit 6%
Project 30%
The grading is fair to be honest. I scored Midterm mean, Final above mean 0.5 sd, project above mean by a little. But I am distracted from the lesson always, so I only answer and participated in few online activities during the lesson, so I guess my class participation cannot get full mark. Hahahaha. Finally B+, I think it is acceptable.
Midterm=26/32
Final=28/32
Project=92/100
reviews.comment_workload: There is no homework, and there are classwork per 2 or 3 lessons I think. The class works are simple if you and your group mates pay attention to the lesson.

reviews.author: sttttttttt
reviews.title: Nice professor! Reg her class!
reviews.comment_content:
There are 10 topics in total.
(1) What's Organizational Behavior?
(2) Personality and Values
(3) Emotion
(4) Perception and Decision Making
(5) Motivation
(6) Groups and Teams
(7) Communication
(8) Leadership
(9) Conflict and Negotiation
(10) Managing Globally
The concepts are not difficult to understand but you have to pay attention in class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Carmen is a very nice professor. She makes the lectures very interesting and explains all the concepts very clearly. She is willing to answer our questions after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is great!!!
Exam1: 25%
Exam2: 25%
Group project: 30%
Class participation: 14%
Research Participation: 6%
For me:
Exam1: ~1.5sd above mean
Exam2: I only got mean
Group project: 1sd above mean
Class participation: I think I get the full point for it
Research Participation: full
My grade: A+, I didn't expect it as I did not do well in exam 2.
As you see, class participation counts a lot so be active and answer questions in class. It helps! Usually, Carmen asks less than 5 questions per class so always be ready to raise up your hands!
Work hard on the group project and exam as the mean is very high.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite light. There is no after-class assignment.

reviews.author: Denzel
reviews.title: Best Course Ever
reviews.comment_content: The content for this course is very interesting as I love the idea of behavior and psychology. I also love how in the group project we're asked to analyze a movie for the final report and presentation !!!
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Carmen is one of the best professors I have ever had in HKUST. I love how she carried her class and her attitude. She always cheered us up with games, psychological tests, and many other things. She definitely made this online learning experience a lot more interactive and fun.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading for this course is quite lenient as you only need to use your logic for most of the exams. You could definitely get B range without studying, however, you would have to understand and memorize the concept if you are aiming for A range
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for this course is quite chill as we only need to do 1 group project, 1 midterm, and 1 final exam. This class is almost like a refreshment for me as it helps me go though my other courses (ISOMs).

reviews.author: Cheukyan
reviews.title: Carmen is really nice and kind!! REG HER
reviews.comment_content: I believe others' reviews can provide more detailed information. Overall her lectures are interesting. Sometimes watching videos and having discussion.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She teaches very clear and her lessons are never dull. Sometimes she will make jokes haha.
Most importantly she is willing and patient to answer your questions and listen to your concerns.
reviews.comment_grading:
Overall grading is fine.
As the questions of the exam are very easy, the mean is very high. Therefore work hard on the project.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload are light. Only a group project, presentation, mid-term with 40 to 50 something mcs and a final which is in form of essay.

reviews.author: heidycheung
reviews.title: easy
reviews.comment_content:
Quite easy. Just some easy concepts and not too much to remember. Not much content. Some related to personal behaviors and some about attitudes personalities......
Week 1 Welcome! Course Introduction
Week 2 Introduction to OB
Week 3 Personality and Values, Perception and Learning I
Week 4 Experiential Learning Exercise I, Perception and Learning II
Week 5 Individual Decision Making, Emotions and Job Attitudes
Week 6 Emotional Labor & Emotional Intelligence, Motivation I
Week 7 Motivation II, Catch-up Exam I Review
Week 8 Exam 1, Team Dynamics I

Week 15 Exam II Review
reviews.comment_teaching: nice teacher. willing to answer questions and have many different activities. Forgot the name of the professor but she has good english accent.
reviews.comment_grading: good grading. The professor gives good grade. i got 97 in the final exam and A in the end.
reviews.comment_workload: ok. Only two exams and some easy assignments. Group project if you could choose the good professor who give good grade then nothing to worry about. But quite a lot of activities in lesson. I think you could just revise for the exam and pay attention in class and you could get good grades.

reviews.author: 粟米忌廉湯
reviews.title: Interesting content and great professor
reviews.comment_content: I think the others have already had a very detailed content description so you may feel free to refer theirs. Mainly about human behavior in the workplace. Somehow related to psychology. (You will love it if you love applied psychology like me :D)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Carmen is a really nice, easygoing and passionate professor. :) She teaches wholeheartedly and she is friendly as well. She always tries to interact and chat with us. When we have questions, she is always happy to help us with detailed and clear explanation. The whole class loves her sooo much. :P

Overall, I think her teaching quality is pretty nice. She has a structured ppt with bullet points and it is good for revision. I'm also quite impressed that her time management for the lesson is quite well. She can always manage to finish everything on time.

Highly recommended!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
For me, grading is very nice. The midterm is all MC questions and final is short questions. Those questions are kind of straightforward. (Just some traps for the MC and you have to pay close attention to it)

For the participation marks, you have to get it by answering questions that Carmen has asked during the lesson, and doing some group assignments in breakout room. I am not sure how many marks does answering one question worth tho.

The project is not that difficult. It's mainly about presenting a movie using those concepts taught (stuff like that)

Also there is a part called research participation. Just attend it and you will get full marks for that.
(Basically everyone scored full marks)

Overall, the mean of the grading should be around B/ B+. A lot of my friends got A range in Carmen's class :D Good luck!!
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload tbh. The main workload should be the project, just pray that you won't have free riders in your group (sadly my group has 1 so u know ...)

For the mid-term and final, i didn't really spend time revising it. Paying attention during lessons and flipping through the notes the day before the exam will be fine.

reviews.author: gracekw
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite interesting and easy... it is about people's characteristics and how it may affect the performance within any organizations.

Ch 1: What's Organizational Behaviour?
Ch 2: Personality and values
Ch 3: Emotion
Ch 4: Perception and Decision Making
Ch 5: Motivation
Ch 6: Groups and Teams
Ch 7: Communication
Ch 8: Leadership
Ch 9: Managing Globally

Mid-term: (50 MC) Ch 1-5
Final: (Short essay questions) Ch 6-9
Group Project: Discuss an OB-related movie, do a presentation and report:)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Carmen is a very nice and passionate professor, she always uses interesting methods to illustrate the concepts as well as allowing more interactions in class. Her ppt are clear and easy to understand, and she will add on a lot of useful information which you can apply in the exams.

Haha she is so cute that she would talk to us in Cantonese when she came into breakout rooms!!
reviews.comment_grading:
14% Class participation
20% Mid-term
30% Final
30% Group project (Report and presentation)
6% Research credit

Attend all the lectures, speak up in class, do revision and prepare well for the project -> All good!
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is alright... only one in-class exercise every one to two weeks, a group project, one mt and final exam. You will be fine as long as you attend the lectures, make sure you are familiar with the concepts and DONT FREERIDE:)

reviews.author: LH1
reviews.comment_content: Basic OB issues, for example, individual decision making, team dynamics, communication, conflict management, leadership, power, influence, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very interactive and interesting class. Nice professor who will help students to prepare for the exam.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fair. Make sure you are active enough in class as class participation and the presentation counts a lot. The exam was also not tricky at all. The class before the exam is usually a review session that gives some clues on how the questions would be and helps you prepare for the exam better.
reviews.comment_workload: Average. 5 people in a group. Many freshmen are taking this course and be ready if your teammate is not yet used to the workload or style of the project in uni. However, it was grouped by the professor and so far every group was ok with it.

reviews.author: Bran
reviews.title: Good professor
reviews.comment_content:
Organizational Behaviors (OB)
personalities and values
Emotion
perception and decision making
motivation
groups and teams
communication
leadership
managing globally
reviews.comment_teaching:
She is nice and can build up the atmosphere during lessons and invited students to participate in some interesting "experiments" to demonstrate some concepts which makes it easier to understand.
Also she replied email very fast and humorous.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class participation 14%
Exam 1 20%
Exam 2 30%
Team project (Presen+written report) 30%
research participation 6%
I got nearly full mark in class parti I guess

Exam 2 36/50 (+1sd)

Research Participation 6/6
A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Light but it really depends on ur group mates in the project. some of my groupmates did a very great job which significantly reduced workload for me.
For the exam, just recite the concepts.

reviews.author: MoSorWaiLa
reviews.title: An interesting course
reviews.comment_content: If you are interested in psychology and human behavior, you will find the course fascinating and fun as it is the field of study related to how individuals/groups/organizations affects the human behavior and team effectiveness. The course is divided into individual and team level, covering a variety of topics likes motivation, perception, team dynamics, emotions and attitudes and stress, leadership, power and influence etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She is an encouraging professor and really respects students' feelings even though you give a wrong answer during the class. Her lecture notes are precise and concise which make me feel very convenient to follow.
There are still a lot of discussions and in-class activities even during online class. If you are not outgoing and talkative, you will perhaps feel a little bit overwhelmed because they are all counted in the participation part.  Overall, however, her lecture is fun and everyone can feel very comfortable to share their thoughts which are very appreciated.
reviews.comment_grading:
Please refer to the attachment.
And here are the class stats,
For Presentation (out of 40 – Bonus for winning presentations included):
Avg: 35.01
SD: 4.39
Median: 37
For Final Report (out of 40):
Avg: 36.29
SD: 3.4
Median: 36
For Final Exam (out of 100):
Avg: 78.58
SD: 13.21
Median: 82

My scores were below mean in both the presentation and final report. But my scores were above 1 SD  during both the midterm and final. At first I thought participation and interaction in class were very important but even though I didn't actively participate much and just answer questions some of the times, my final grade is still A. I think you don't need to push yourself very hard to answer all the questions every lesson to earn the participation (it's quite stressful indeed) but just give yourself a try if you know the answers.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 2 exams, 1 progress report, 1 final report and 1 presentation in total. The exams are not very hard if you understand the concepts and know how to apply in daily life. The workload of the project depends greatly on your groupmates. Like me, I encountered free-riders in my team and I need to deal with part of their jobs as well so the workload was quite heavy to me. Similar to the exams, the project examines the degree of your ability to apply OB concepts in your chosen movie while the presentation is testing your communication skills and team dynamics. Since the presentation will be spread out in 3-4 lessons, if you are arranged to present on the first day of the presentation, you might feel more pressured as it is the day of your final report deadline as well. And for the others, they might have more time to prepare for the power point and presentation. So, the workload depends.

reviews.author: ahtai
reviews.comment_content: not bad...easy to understand just give you some basic knowledge on OB
reviews.comment_teaching: very good and funny. She will distribute lots of experiment ,even lecture slides, for you to do during lesson. Her slides are clean, easy and well-organised to read
reviews.comment_grading: not much to say...the average score of midterm and final will be high, better do well in the project to secure a better grade
reviews.comment_workload:
midterm(MC)+final(essay)+project
workload is light and you just need to do revision before exam. everything can be found in her slides
Btw......cheat sheet allowed for the final

reviews.author: v.v.v
reviews.comment_content:
Personality and Values, Emotions and Job Attitudes, Leadership, Power & Influence, Motivation...

To me it's kinda boring. You'll be interested in if you like psychology, but the materials are basically just common sense loll.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I can tell that the professor tried hard to make the lecture interesting. But honestly, the materials are just so... hmm, thus I still found it boring.

And make sure you keep your technology away. Laptops, tablets, mobile phones must be in your bag during class unless directed to use it by the instructor.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 20%
Final 30%
Group project 30%
Class participation 14%
Research participation 6%

Better answer at least one question in every class to get a participation card. It's easy to get the card, the more the better.

I guess the professor took the participation cards, peer evaluation, and teammates' comments seriously. Tho I was around mean on Midterm, I got an A in the end.
reviews.comment_workload:
The final project is about learning OB from Movies. What you have to do is to choose a movie for the project, prepare a two-page progress report about mid-way through the project, and turn in a 10-page report, and make a 12- minute presentation to the class followed by 5minutes of Q&A.

Basically depends on your teammates. And better pray for good teammates cuz mine are shitty :)

You'll need to finish all these tasks with your teammates, or sometimes, alone :)))

reviews.comment_teaching:
Kapadia teaches very well. Her lesson would not be very bored and she will explain beyond the ppt slide. Hence, simply reading ppt and not attending lessons will make you miss some concepts and examples. However, lecture videos are provided so it is fine. She always ask questions in class and develop on the questions raised by students. There are some lessons held outside classroom to play games.
For the project, Kapadia helps a lot in the suggestion and improvement. After the progress report, there is a consulting session for us to ask for opinions regarding the project. She is really nice and willing to answer questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair for this course.
Midterm 20%
Final 30%
Team project 30%
Class participation 14%
Research participation 6%

I am slightly below mean in midterm. Also, the format of final change to online exam, the exam is changed to essay type. Not many OB concepts required tbh. The final mark do not released. I got a B. I think it is fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fair for a 3 cred course if you have good teammate. If the part that everyone working on are well defined, the project will not cost you many time. Indeed, the workload of the project in this class is relatively light since our project is movie reviewing, compared to other professors' project topic.

reviews.author: hlalau
reviews.comment_content: Different concepts in Organizational Behavior. First part (before mid-term) focuses on individual worker. Second part of the course would be focusing on team.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is nice and she teaches with her own experience, videos and games.
reviews.comment_grading:
Exam I: 20%
Exam II: 30%
Team Project: 30%
Class Participation: 14%
Research Participation: 6%

Due to the social instability, exam II is cancelled this semester. Team Project is easy, all based on a movie you choose that can use the concepts you learnt in this course. If you are willing to answer questions and express opinion during class, a participation card will be given. Research Participation is just helping the school to complete 3 surveys in total.

MAINPOINT: good grade is given (at least to me lol)
reviews.comment_workload: Nothing much is needed to be done except the group project.

reviews.comment_content:
Covers wide range of content, about human psychological behaviour. Bias, team, and more.

I personally think the content is too much.
Very hard to memorise everything.

Teaching is good, talks very fluently.
She should have taught this course for many semesters already.
Sometimes have some interactions.
Will give out participation card for each question answered in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Project presentation: Highest

Fair I suppose?

Have 2 minor assignments. One major group project which takes time as need to present and type report.

Need much time to memorise everything for exams.

reviews.author: ak_hkust
reviews.title: Do yourself a favour and take Prof Kapadia's class
reviews.comment_content: The content of MGMT is more or less same throughout all the sections. It is very interesting, mainly dealing with different OB concepts applied to workplaces, substantiated further by interesting experiments. Her slides are not detailed and but the content is interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Melody as a professor is extremely horrible, and this is an understatement. She reads off slides, has the most boring monotone, and achieves one of the most difficult tasks in MGMT 2110: she makes OB boring. Trust me, do yourself a favour and do NOT take her class, instead take Prof Chaitali's class. She is absolutely brilliant.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is quite good for the course , easy A range if you do well in the midterm and final (0.8-1 SD above), but trust me, if you want good grades and genuinely want to learn the interesting world of OB, take prof Chaitali's class
reviews.comment_workload: Her final project is not analyzing a movie using OB concepts which is practical and fun, rather it is to write an unnecessary 15 page long RESEARCH PAPER on the most cliche of topics like Gender and diversity or Artificial Intelligence. So useless and impractical.

She is a good teacher. She explains the concepts in a very detailed way and uses many examples to illustrate the concepts. She speaks with an accent but still understandable if you listen carefully.
She shows us many videos in the class and they are quite interesting.
reviews.comment_grading:
good grading
midterm(67/70)
progress report (19/20)

presentation (35/40)
final (97/100)
grade A
it is a bit lower than my expectation.

1 final, short questions and essay
group project, write reports & present  (if you get freerider in your group, then you will have heavier workload)
3 research participation
the workload is quite light.

reviews.author: mariemaris
reviews.comment_content: Covers individual behaviour in all kinds of organisations, many examples, games to illustrate and quite interactive.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very refreshing and easy to follow. The Prof. tries her best to make it as fascinating and worthwhile as she can.
reviews.comment_grading: Every time you speak in class you get one participation card that will help you get a good grade in attendance.  From what she said grading will is pretty fair and based on the effort you put in. Update will follow later.
reviews.comment_workload: Motivation seems to be a major factor of assessment. Theres a fun group work about a movie and a paper to hand in. Attendance in lecture and research participation count into the workload and grade as well.

reviews.author: bigyeet
reviews.title: I Highly recommend you choose this teacher
reviews.comment_content: The Content is great it's all very straightforward and super easy to understand. It was easier for me because I've taken IB Psychology and IB Business in the past so I basically already knew everything.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She teaches really well. She always tries to engage the class. Mainly just goes through the powerpoints but I personally still found the classes interesting despite it being a 9am.
Sometimes her accent is a little bit strange like a few words and phrases were said that I didn't quite get but its honestly not a serious problem because her super sweet personality and very generous grading makes up for it.
reviews.comment_grading:
Ok so here's the thing, her grading is a bit questionable. I'm not complaining I got an A, but I don't understand how. So I had a friend who scored higher than me in literally every aspect of the course (except for class participation probably because I was pretty much always in class and contributed A LOT to discussions), BUT she got a B and I got an A so not sure how that happened. Her grading could be slightly subjective, but i really can't tell.
Just another heads up this is one of those courses where a whole bunch of things add up towards your big grade. The weighting is all spread out through your coursework and final and midterm exams, so it's ok if you don't score super high in your exams because you can still make up for it with your coursework.
reviews.comment_workload:
Decent there was 2 reports, one was more extensive than the other. Since the content was very easy to understand writing the report was not a major issue.
In terms of the presentation, my group spent a lot of time on it and it turned out really good. We didn't get the best grade for it tho, but I was still really happy with it. We needed to make it creative yet informative too. Remember with the presentation if your group presents first in a 9am class, chances are even if you have the best presentation ever, you won't get voted by your peers for best presentation because none of them will be there since no one shows up to a 9am class on time lol. So my group missed out on super important bonus points just because we presented first and a random group that presented last would always win it regardless of how good their presentations were.
Mid-term she gave us a cheat sheet so that was great even though we really didn't need it. All multiple choice
Final no cheat sheet and was essay-based questions, super easy one of my favorite finals to write.

reviews.author: MYGPASUCKS
reviews.title: all about memorising the ppt
reviews.comment_content:
If you did not pay attention in class, there are lecture videos on canvas.

analyze management  issues  at  the  individual,  team  and  organizational  levels  critically and creatively.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tbh, I think her teaching is good and she is a young prof that she will try to make her lesson as fruitful as she can. (For example, she will include a lot of real-life cases and video clips in her classes.)

Also, she worked so closely with TA and conducted a lot of class activities like negotiation game, teamwork game, blahlahlah.

Just I didn't pay any attention during class coz I didn't like attending classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
All you have to do is to be proactive and answer questions during the classes. Those questions are just common sense and related to video/content she shared in the class.
The Prof will jot down your name and further remember your name if you answered questions.
Also, you can try to initiate a discussion on the canvas discussion board. I think it will help too.

Add oil with ur project, the workload is light. Peer evaluation will take place after the presentation.

For mid-term & Final,
Mid term is in MC. I didn't study + have super urgent things to do. I just randomly fill in the MC sheet and left, turn out I was the lowest in class.

As for the final exam, it includes short questions and long questions. She will give out the exam syllabus/related topic list beforehand (the last lesson). All you have to do is to research more information regarding the topic and revise them all coz you are not allowed to make cheatsheet.
Believe it or not, I got full marks in the final and got a B- grade at last.
reviews.comment_workload:
The only workload is just the project + there are 6 ppl in one group. So it doesn't take you much time.

If you really wanna invest your time in this course, do revise the ppt and important content. This course is all about being proactive in class and memorise things that tested in the final exam.

I would say it is really a good course.
Do study hard if you wanna "chok grade" or get MGMT major

reviews.author: Leungsiuli
reviews.comment_content:
Basic knowledge of organizational behaviors.
Somethings like how to choose the best leadership styles based on the personality of subordinates, or how to communicate well with colleagues/superiors/subordinates effectively.
reviews.comment_teaching: Carmen is so nice and she will chat with students frequently. She is so humorous and I think almost all students like her lessons with a relaxing atmosphere. She also teaches well which perfectly matches her teaching schedule.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class participation         14%
(through iprs and answering carmen's questions, but I think it is still suitable for introverts since you can get attendance marks even though you are not active in answering any questions.)
Midterm                          20%
(mc only with no cheat sheet, it is an easy task as long as you memorize all powerpoints)
Final exam                      30%
(essay form with a cheat sheet, some questions were quite tricky in which the content came from additional information provided by carmen, which was not provided directly from the powerpoints)
Group project                  30%
(5 people in a group, better to form the group as soon as possible, otherwise, it is so embarrassing when you find that all people have already formed their groups. A presentation and written report are needed)
Research participation    6%
(attend 3 sessions of research activities)
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload since no homework is required to finish in this course. Be careful of the group project and choose your groupmates wisely. I could see quite a lot of groups are not that well-prepared for the presentation.

reviews.author: ccheryl
reviews.title: nice professor and good grading
reviews.comment_content:
1. Personality and values
2. Perception and Learning
3. Emotion, Attitude, and stress
