reviews.author: therock
reviews.title: BS class but Easy
reviews.comment_content: Most of the content is super logical and all you really need to know are the names of the theories/case study examples, but the understanding itself should be self-explanatory. No need to proper 'memorize' anything if you understand human nature and societal relations to an extent.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor tries to make the class more fun and interesting (not much she can do with such self-explanatory content, but she does really try). Still, I found myself going on my phone in all lectures, gets boring even with all her efforts. She is nice though.
reviews.comment_grading: Midterm and final I got about 1.25 above mean, for the team project we got around 1 SD above, research I got full marks (3/3). Participation wasn't released but I'm guessing I didn't do so great since I was on my phone in all the lectures, and missed 2-3 of them. Final grade was an A+ though, meaning grading is really good! You can use a cheat sheet in the midterm so you just need to understand the concepts and apply them rather than memorize, final is longer answer based, so again you need to understand concepts (not memorize info).
reviews.comment_workload: Very little workload, the biggest part was team project, but we did the progress report the night before, and final started maybe a week and a half ahead of time. Overall, I definitely spent less than 20 hours outside of class on this course (3 hours research, approx. 10 hours on team project, and less than 7 hours on studying for midterm and final).

reviews.author: Kabul
reviews.title: Too academic to be practical...
reviews.comment_content:
Lots and lots of theories and research results... These are indeed something interesting to know, but it seems that the more important part for us is how real companies nowadays apply these managerial principles to handle different situations. It's such a pity that the content in this course remains in the ivory tower and does not really translate into something potentially useful in the real corporate world. Yep it does teach you the process of emotional regulation, but it does not help you increase your EQ. Yep it tells you where your leadership power comes from, but it does not help you become a good leader. Yep it teaches you the Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs and the Job Characteristic's Model, but after learning all these you still don't know how to motivate people.

I understand that OB principles should be evidence-based and well supported by research results, but I think we students want more than just research results. It's about how companies apply the principles, not just research results.

1️⃣ What's OB?
2️⃣ Personality and Values
3️⃣ Emotion
4️⃣ Perception and Decision Making
5️⃣ Motivation
6️⃣ Group & Teams
7️⃣ Communication
8️⃣ Leadership
9️⃣ Managing Globally
reviews.comment_teaching:
Pretty nice teaching. Heavy Hong Kong Chinglish accent, but largely understandable. But the bad thing is again, she's too academically oriented. I'd personally prefer an instructor that has real experience in managing companies, instead of one that stays in the research domains.

(Am I a little too harsh...?)
reviews.comment_grading:
Carmen's exam style is quite direct. Basically just trivial facts and make sure you dig into the details.

💬 14% Class Participation
✏️ 20% Exam 1 (Multiple Choices)
✏️ 30% Exam 2 (Essay)
💬✏️ 30% Project (Presentation + Written Report)
🏫 6% Research Participation

I got 1.3 SD above mean in Exam 1, 1.6 SD above mean in Exam 2 and 1.3 SD above mean in the project.

💯 Final grade: A+

It's easy to score high in Exam 2 as soon as you've jotted down answers to the discussion questions in class and put them on the cheat sheet.
reviews.comment_workload:
Most of the workload lies on the group project, which includes a 12-page report and a 15-min presentation. The project is an analysis of any OB-related movie you like and we're required to dig out the OB issues and discuss their real-life implications.

The rest of the workload is basically in-class and research participation, which should be easy for most of you.

Exam 1 is closed book multiple choices. Basically just rote memorization of facts. Exam 2 is open book essay-based questions, which are even easier.

However, for the final exam, there were 6 questions in which as long as you explain in depth, you'll get the marks for it.  Cheat sheet was also allowed so please write everything down.

reviews.author: little potatoo
reviews.comment_content:
Course Objectives
1. To demonstrate your understanding of major concepts and theories in OB.
2. To develop an understanding of personal strengths and weaknesses in organizational contexts.
3. To analyze management issues at the individual, team and organizational levels in a critical and
creative manner.
a. Being critical refers to the application of OB theories to solving organizational problems
in a manner that shows your awareness of (i) exactly how the theory of your choice applies to the issue being analyzed and (ii) the risks and benefits associated with each solution suggested.
b. Being creative refers to finding solutions to management issues not necessarily referred to in your textbook, as long as such solutions are theoretically justified.
4. To apply concepts and theories in OB learned in this course to solve business problems.
5. To communicate and present your ideas clearly, persuasively, and professionally (through
writing, presentations, and discussions).
6. To enhance your personal ability to function effectively in a multicultural settings.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Lucia is really a great professor! She is humorous and very engaging. Lucia like using Chinglish to tell jokes and create a fun atmosphere for students to learn. And she will really try to know every student in her classes. You will be surprised when she can tell your name even you never say any words in class. At the first class, she creates a context for the whole semester that the class is a company and she is the boss while students are employees.
The project group is assinged by her and students will sit with group mates throughout the whole semester which is for class discussions.

Her teaching is easy to understand and if you attend all her lessons, you even do not really need to memorise anything for the two exam. She plays a lot of short videos which are very helpful for learning the OB concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
-20%- Exam I (MC only)
-30%- Exam II (Essay only)
-30%- Group Project
-14%- Class Participation (iprs quiz+presentation day attendance+class activity)
-6%- Research Participation

Both exam is not difficult as students could bring a reference (cheat) sheet that a note card delivered by Lucia for the midterm and a A4-paper reference sheet for the final exam.
Details of group project > workload
The good thing is Lucia gives really constructive suggestions on where to keep and where to improve. But the grade of final report and presentation are not released!
For the participation, there are a number of IPRS quizzes and the dates are stated on the syllabus. It is super easy as you can simply look at the notes or discuss with other group mates/class mates to find out the answer within the limited time. Lucia encourages us to discuss and find out the correct answer so the quizzes are easy. The class activities dates are also stated and are only game-like activities so no worry about the workload. For the presentation day attendance, students just vote for the best presentation that day through iprs and Lucia never allows cheating (ask codes from other and skip the lessons).

Research Participation is common in business courses. It is required for each student to join 3 research studies throughout the semester. The details are sent through email.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is relatively low comparing to other courses with group project.
For the group project, members are grouped by Lucia according to a personality test. She tries to group different kinds of students into one group and hopes that students can learn to collaborate with students with totally different personality traits. The content is easy as you need to choose a movie and analyse the OB concepts which is all taught in class. The project is helpful with revising the final!! She gives sufficient time for preparing the report and presentation so the workload is not heavy.
The research participation is quite time-consuming as students cannot leave at the point of finishing the survey, instead, stay there for 1 hour. Also, students really need to pay attention to the emails that they can register for the best timeslot as the competition is extremely keen and you may fail to join the study.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Tali is a very knowledgeable and generous person to start with. She is interactive and if you are an active student in the class, she will remember your name (which is important if you want a good grade in the end).
Although she may seem like a rookie in SBM, she was professional and as her student, it was comfortable to be in her classes. Anything you didn't know she would try her best to answer and explain.
I highly recommend registering for this instructor.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is rather lenient, which what all students like to hear.
Important components are mid-terms, finals, and the group project.
Mid-terms was MC, Finals was all short essay type questions; not difficult at all. As long as you are able to effectively show that you can process, explain and apply the teaching contents in the assignments, you will be fine.
For the group project, pray hard that you get good teammates because this can be the turning point for your grades for this course. This is not the kind of group project where you can manage it on your own. I was very lucky to have good teammates. You will be required to choose a movie and analyze it according to the concepts taught in class; again, not difficult as long as everyone plays their part.
P.S.: A+
reviews.comment_workload:

The workload is generally distributed very evenly and as a student, I found it easy to cope with what this course requires me to submit and deliver. The workload is very reasonable. For mid-terms and finals, if you study hard, it is easy to reach up to 80-90%.
Sometimes she uses iPRS to take attendance, but most importantly, participate actively.

reviews.comment_workload:
Simple and straightforward as long as u elab and connect everything tgt.

For midterm, it consists of 56 MCs. She will ask u basically everything including OB table, Hofstede's Cultural dimensions, Mintzberg's managerial roles. (some qs are just directly copied from the lecture ppts) so copy everything on lecture ppt will do.

For project, groupmates will be assigned according to an OCEAN personality test. My group consists of 4 types of people who are more relationship-oriented, focus on big picture, detail-minded (conscientious), and spontaneous people. It worked okay for us. You have to pick an OB movie and apply theories to explain the behaviours (whether it is effective/ineffective). Include as many concepts as possible and link everything tgt.

For project presentation, be as creative as possible. Although you are asked to wear smart casual, people do talk shows, drama, role plays etc (there is a creativity mark for presentation)

For final, just like the project, link everything tgt. there are 6 short questions. You are allowed to bring 1 A4 cheat sheet. just write every definition on it and link everything tgt. super easy

reviews.author: klaw
reviews.comment_content:
Very interesting and 100% applicable to daily life.

She will move on to a new chapter every week, chapters in this course includes:
1. Emotions and moods
2. Personality and values
3. Perceptions and decision making
4. Motivation
5. Communication
6. Leadership
7. Conflict and negotiation
8. Team behaviour

While this course will not turn you into OB expert right away, it should lay a good foundation to help you become more effective and satisfied organizational members.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Her way of teaching makes the course thought provoking and fun. She encourages students to participate (but doesn't base final grade on class participation) by rewarding us with candies. She is so kind and warm and loving.

She gives very concrete real life examples while explaining about concepts and encourages team discussion so we can really grasp what she is talking about. Also, her PPT is very simple and easy to read with very little text, so reviewing for exams are not that hard. In addition, I feel like I already understand a lot just by listening in class.

The class itself does not only consist of listening to her talk on and on for 1 hour. Instead, she divide it between lectures, interactive exercises, videos, mini case analysis, and discussions. You will never get bored.

We also get to do a lot of personality tests and its always fun to know more about yourself, especially with Lucia to explain what each of the personality means and its strengths and weaknesses etc.

Always finishes class 10-15 minutes early after taking attendance by IPRS. She will stay in class for students who want to ask her questions. Very helpful and genuinely wants her students to understand and have fun learning.

Best professor in UST!
reviews.comment_grading:
Examination I MC (60 MCQ) 20%
Examination II Essay (6 LQ) 30%
Team project 30%
Class participation 14% (4% + 3% + 7%)
Research participation 6%

You are only allowed to bring in a 4x6" reference card for the midterm exam, and an A4 cheat sheet for final exam.

Class participation is attendance for 2 in-class activities (each 2%), presentation day attendance (3 days, each 1%) and regular class attendance (use IPRS to answer 5 questions based on the previous lecture in each class, count best 10 out of 14). You can skip up to 4 regular classes and still get full class participation. There are 3 research study you have to participate in, but if you somehow didn't get the study or missed it, you can always tell Lucia and she will tell you to write a 500 word essay (super easy, maybe even easier than going to the study) to make up for it.

Very good grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not that heavy, despite having a group project. She will determine your group mates based on a personality test. For me, my group mates were awesome and we clicked so much. This made working for the project enjoyable and not a burden.

The project itself is actually quite fun as we get to analyze a movie based on OB concepts learned in class. We were encouraged to be creative with our presentation and people were doing role play, talk shows, drama, etc. It was fun and watching the presentations were not boring.

reviews.author: FelixCheng
reviews.title: Good Instructor!
reviews.comment_content:
This course is about Organizational Behavior. From my perspective, OB is somehow like common sense, but professor says it isn't. There are three levels of outcomes in OB, and they are individual level, group level and organizational level. This course mainly discusses about the individual level and group level. (Though contents might vary from sessions to sessions)

Contents:
1. First, it talks about What is OB?
2. In individual level of OB, it talks about Personality and Values, Emotion, Perception and Decision Making, and Motivation.
3. In group level of OB, it talks about Groups and Teams, Communication, and Leadership.
4. At last, it talks about Managing Globally.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Carmen is always well prepared with the lecture. All the slides are well designed by herself, with interesting games, pictures, stories and videos. She will provide all the printed material for all students before the class, because she believe taking notes on the paper is much better than taking notes on the laptop. BTW, she will remember all your faces, do raise hands during the lectures!
However, she speaks a little bit fast, and there are some blanks on the lecture notes. You need to pay full attention in the lecture to take down what she says. (The exams will test the discussion in the lecture, you had better to take those notes down!)
reviews.comment_grading:
My midterm is mean, final is mean + 1SD.
Project gains the highest score. (mean + 1SD)
The overall grade is A-. I am pretty satisfied.

The grading is assigned by the following.
1. Class Participation (14%)
I tick attendance in the box, because there will be iPRS every lecture. But I remember she says 75% participation is enough for her. Do raise questions and answer questions, she will remember all your faces!
2. Mid-Term (60 Multiple Choices) (20%)
Closed book, do look through all your lecture notes and understand the concepts.
3. Final (6 Questions) (30%)
One two-side A4 cheat sheet.
4. Team Project (Presentation + Written Report) (30%)
Group in 5. Choose your interested movie and analyze the OB inside the movie.
5. Research Participation (6%)
Attend three 1-hour research (2% each), you will receive e-mail notification, register early!
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework.
3 research participation, 1 project, 1 midterm, 1 final.
I think this course is all about understanding and remembering! There are some workload during the project and right before the exams!

reviews.author: catarina
reviews.comment_content: The content for this course is extremely easy and straightforward. Insanely easy for anyone to understand. Definitely some of the easiest course material I have had in university, however it is anything but interesting. The course gets boring extremely quickly because everything we're learning seems to be the same thing as applying logic.
reviews.comment_teaching: Riki is quite a nice guy. He loves talking (especially about himself and his research) and is generally quite chill. However, his lectures aren't that interesting or stimulating, especially since he is quite monotone in his speech. Also, he has a rather bad habit of forgetting to provide us with details for assignments. For example, he asked us to write an "introduction card" for our group project but gave no explanation as to what that's supposed to mean. Only on the due date when it was brought to his attention that he didn't explain the assignment did he clarify what he looked for (the due date was postponed). There were many similar instances. He often isn't clear.
reviews.comment_grading: Wonderful. My midterm was roughly 1 sd above mean. I have no clue what my final exam score was but I assume I did extremely well. I also assume did well for the major project. There was no transparency on grading before the final grade came out. Final score A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Light. Other than the term project, there is no work outside of class. There is one midterm and one final, as well as one project that includes an essay and a presentation. But extremely easy to handle.

reviews.author: Suan
reviews.comment_content: Organizational Behavior is about personality, leadership, and others. Some of the content is similar to a psychological course but in a more business way
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof is chatty, can communicate with both Cantonese and English. PPT in every lesson have fill-in-the-blank. Must attend each lesson in order to gain team participation.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good. Even my team only get half of the participation point and a fair performance in presentation, I still get good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Although there is a project about analyzing a movie, it is interesting and quite fun.

reviews.author: rachelllim
reviews.comment_content: Interesting content where many relevant concepts are studied. It was my first time taking a MGMT course and after doing so, it made me want to choose it as a major.
reviews.comment_teaching: Profesor Farh is proactive and encourages in-class participation. He will also give you help when you need it.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grades if you hand in your work in time and properly. The exams are not difficult if you study for it.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite heavy but it can be divided amongst your friends because a large part of the grade is based on the group project.

reviews.author: Avocado
reviews.title: Interesting and engaging.
reviews.comment_content: The content itself was really interesting, and it also seemed very practical and applicable to real life. A lot of it is based on concepts from psychology and sociology, so it helps if you have a background in those subjects (you might be a little bit more familiar with the terms etc).
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Farh is a really engaging professor who tries his very best to make sure his students understand the content and are coping well with the workload. He is always open to answering questions, and is very helpful. I approached him a few times with regards to the group project, and he was very helpful and even sent me some research journals related to the topic of our research paper. He is really kind and approachable, and is definitely one of the friendliest professors I've had.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was pretty decent for the course. There is one midterm, a group project (research paper), in-class exercises, attendance, and a final exam which make up your final grade for the course. In the midterm, I got 1 SD above mean, however I don't know the marks for my final exam or report as they were not released (however, I was very satisfied with my performance on both and think I did well). In-class attendance is taken through the PRS system, and it helps to go to lecture as participation makes up around 14% of your grade. In the end, I got an A+ for this course.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was alright, as there are assigned readings before each class. Although it is not required, I recommend you do the readings as they help you to keep up with the material on the class. Also, the final exam had some questions on content which was in the assigned readings but wasn't covered explicitly in class, so I advise you to complete the readings. The majority of the workload, however, comes from the group project where you have to write a research paper on a OB topic (you are given 4 general areas, and have to choose one). If you have group mates that don't do much, good luck, because you'll need it. I highly recommend that you DON'T leave the paper until the last minute, because it takes a lot of time and effort to produce a good and thorough paper. There is also a presentation to complete based on your research paper, however it's not as tough and the professor is quite lenient with the presentation (just make it interesting and engaging and Professor Farh will like it).

reviews.author: Noa
reviews.title: He tries his best to keep it interesting
reviews.comment_content: Alot of psychology and quite interesting material, but you still need to learn it book style and know all the correct terms. It's fun material in itself but learning all the proper terms can be draining.
reviews.comment_teaching: Larry tries to keep things interesting with in class activities and giving out papers for participation, so people are really active. He is a very nice professor who genuinely tries to help. He coached me through my entire group paper when my group decided to vanish into thin air.
reviews.comment_grading: Very fair grading, plus extra marks if you participate and come to office hours. I participated alot and went to alot of office hours and got an A+, even though my assignment and test marks were in the A- range. Put in the effort and let it show and you can get an amazing mark.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too bad! There is reading before class which are not mandatory but i suggest you do. The only homework is really the 15 page research paper and presentation which you have the entire semester to complete. Don't procrastinate though! There are also in class PRS which really only measure attendance.

reviews.author: Elise
reviews.comment_content: the content is rich, you can learn a lot inside the course although it is not much related to business content.
reviews.comment_teaching: the teaching is good, Professor is funny and will try to make the students to have more engagement in the class.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading. I didn't attend to all the lessons, and also didn't answer much of the professor questions. Yet, I still got a A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
light. Not much work.
There are lots of in class activities, and also have group project with light workload. The project is not difficult and can have fun with groupmates.

reviews.author: Aria
reviews.comment_content: The contents of the course were quite interesting. Professor Farh also included a lot of psychology elements into his teaching and lessons were more fun because of this.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Farh is a nice person and he is very open to questions. He would very oftenly include activities during class and they would make the classes more interactive and fun.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was quite good for the course. Cheat sheets were allowed during the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload was acceptable and were not particularly heavy or light. There is one group project, one mid term and one final exam.

reviews.author: weeheeoo
reviews.comment_content: People who loves psychology and social science will love this course much. This course talks about personality, values, power, communication, leadership...etc. All are about human thoughts and behaviour.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is really kind to her students and passionate in teaching. She encourages students to raise hands and is welcome to all opinion. Her questions in class are relatively easy with no model answer, or you can find them in lecture notes. My best lecturer in UST
reviews.comment_grading:
Group attendance and group project occupies much, so it will be lucky if your groupmates attend lessons everytime. Groupmates are randomly assigned, or some people say they are assigned according to the 5 Ocean score, a test which shows your personality, that you will be assigned to work with people whose 5 Ocean score differs form you. Presentation is required and she will look at your bonding with group as well. iPRS is required for every lesson and you cant find others to press for you because she counts the number of head everytime. iPRS also makes up some of the mark. Midterm is all MC with difficulty of medium. Mean is around 4x/6x. Final is 3-4 short ques with a 20 points essay, All answers of short ques can be directly copied from cheatsheet (lecture notes) while the essay is actually very easy to score high coz it only requires a line of answer and a line of explanation for each point.

My midterm above 1.5 SD, Final not known coz she didnt reveal the mark,attendance should be around 95%. Final grade A+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light. No homework, just group project required. The group project is to analyse a movie chosen by your team, which is actually an easy task. You are only required to attend every lesson on time.

reviews.author: hikaarie
reviews.comment_content: content is fun as it is about human behaviour which related to our daily life.
reviews.comment_teaching:
quite interesting with some exercises to understand some of the theory.
melody is always energetic and provide good lecture notes which i do not need to read the textbook
reviews.comment_grading:
if your mid term and final exam is above mean around 1 sd can get b+
the grading of the final project is unknown so i do not know about the actual mark.
attendance is needed as each group have to complete one worksheet  every lesson
reviews.comment_workload: one mc mid term, one group project with presentation and one final exam of writing essay.

reviews.author: Winki
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite interesting. It is somewhat related to psychology. The course covers topics like attitude, decision-making, perception, motivations, conflicts, etc...
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very nice. She's very encouraging and she tried not to put much pressure on her students. I love how she shared her personal experiences related to the concept with us.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is fair.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair. There is a mid-term exam (MC format) and a final exam(MC + essay format) but there is only one group project. You have to do a presentation towards the end of the course. Also, you have to participate in 3 researches so as to pass the course.

reviews.author: DJ
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course material was neither good nor bad. Some stuffs are really basic that you don't really need to study for it but some other stuffs are I guess professional knowledge. However, most of the contents covered in this course are psychology related (e.g. how you tend to think in your daily life etc.). Thus there was not really chance to learn about management which is quite awkward knowing that this course is about management anyways.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor was really good in terms of his teaching skills. He prepares lots of examples to stimulate your understanding about a concept covered in his lecture. He also prepares lots of exercises in classes. If you are a kind of student who dislikes practice exercise to be graded, this is not a course for you. However, I really enjoyed most exercises in the course and the professor was really a pleasure to have.
reviews.comment_grading: I did not really have chance to review my exams (e.g. which questions I got right and wrong); For midterm I got 0.5 STDEV above and for final I did not get the standard deviation and the score. For rest of assignments the professor commented on our performance but once again, I did not have a chance to look and compare my score to others. However, the grading itself overall is okay.
reviews.comment_workload: There are a lot of workloads such as presentation, essay, preparation for exam, exercises, assignments and stuff. If you are enrolled in courses that require hard work, I do not recommend this course.

reviews.author: ustgrad
reviews.title: MGMT Review
reviews.comment_content: The content coverage is very comprehensive and he tests everything that he teaches in class + some textbook contents. Just read everything for the exams. Plus, for mid terms and finals, there will cheat sheet allowed so type as much as you can into the cheat sheet.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is interesting and he asks many questions in class. He also brings guest lecturer into class. Lectures are not boring at all.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good if you participate enough. Just make sure you answer some questions in class, do the project paper well and complete all necessary quizzes and class work!
reviews.comment_workload:
WORKLOAD IS CRAZY FOR PROJECT!!!!!!!

I am not even kidding, the research paper can be a pain if you have bad group mates. Requires extensive journal readings and academic paper readings. Compared to other Profs the research paper is really mad.

Other in-class exercises and exams / quizzes are manageable. For exams just read all the materials he lists and do all the questions he revised in class before. Format of questions will be very similar. Other than project, the other stuff is less demanding.

reviews.author: Avi
reviews.comment_content: I personally found most of the content to be very trivial and on the surface. Some content was important like how groups behaved and certain methods to prevent phenomenons like groupshift and groupthink - this could be applied straightaway in real life so there was some real application. However, I found the content itself to be very simple - use this to your advantage.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lucia was a very bouncy professor. She had a lot of energy and every lesson was entertaining. And for that sole reason, I actually enjoyed the class.
reviews.comment_grading: Scoring high is relatively easy if you study - I found that a lot of students perceived OB as a bs class and for that did not study for their exams. The midterm is very easy and you just have to use your cheat sheet well in order to score high. There were small details like what personality type is it when a person is sociable - and you have to refer to Holland's Personality Types for that (she barely touched on it during the lecture). I scored 2 sds above the mean for the midterm and for the final and was able to attain an A+ even though our group presentation was meh.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload was very light throughout most of the semester. It got more intense as coursework deadlines got closer - coursework includes a report coupled with a presentation.

One midterm - MCQ
One final - essay (you have to really understand the material and connect everything together in order to score high)

reviews.author: Roddie
reviews.title: Business Psycology
reviews.comment_content: Basically, organizational behavior is like business psychology, it tells you the rationale behind of how people make decisions and why would they make mistakes while making decisions. Five different ways to avoid conflicts based on different scenario, and others.
reviews.comment_teaching: Larry's class is, admittedly, not so interesting. And in most of the class, I feel sleepy, perhaps is because that his voice is too soft and usually speaks in low volume, and the combination between these two components make me feel sleepy lol. But he is very responsible since he will reply your questions regard to whether group project, presentation or about OB clearly. And you will get some tips for presentation and group project is you ask.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is very good, I think. Hence this course used to be my nightmare since I get slightly below mean in the midterm. There are some questions from the textbook, but not from the slides. I was too lazy to read the textbook, and hence my result of the midterm is bad.
But our group presentation and group project is quite good, since we've spent quite a lot of time and effort in it.
I don't know the result of my final, but I think I've aced  it since I checked my answer with my friends.(And I spent 5 days reading the textbooks), and tried to use as many OB words as possible while answering the essay long questions.
Eventually, I got A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
The group project is quite annoying, since you need to read a lot of academic journals, and sometime, the academic journals that you read is completely irrelevant. Hence, many effort will be taken for group presentation and group project..
Also, for having the grade that you want, you need to read the textbook, and it is quite time-consuming as well.

reviews.author: MC
reviews.comment_content:
Organizational Behavior

midterm 25%
final 25%
project report 10%
presentation 10%
progress report 5%
participation 14%
peer evaluation 5%
research studies 6%
reviews.comment_teaching:
i attend lectures because there is participation

when you answer his question, he will ask follow up questions to make sure you give detailed explanation lol


ppt is not easy to read , it is word lengthy

its better to attend the lessons because the final exam will cover some of the class activities like desert survival activity
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm only MC - no cheat sheet allowed

final MC+essay 40% Mc 1%@
essay 60% choose 3 out of 4 essay 20%@ - one cheat sheet allowed
i left 10% unanswered  in final
stil got B+

only the result of midterm given

so this course  lacks transparency
reviews.comment_workload:
Project
Presentation
midterm
final exam
a lot of deadlines

reviews.author: LeoLibra107
reviews.title: Every drop counts
reviews.comment_content:
There are three levels in organization but in this course we will only study the first two parts - individual and group.
　
1) Personalities and Values
2) Attitudes and Job Satisfaction
3) Emotions and Moods
4) Motivations
5) Perception and Individual Decision Making
6) Team Dynamics
7) Communications
8) Conflicts and Negotiation

Actually there is "leadership and power" in our syllabus but we didn't manage to cover it.

In general the class is fun and the concepts are interesting. Get a textbook because lecture notes are insufficient for exam preparation.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Chao is really enthusiastic and willing to listen to students' feedback. The vibe is quite strange for my class, classmates rarely talk or respond to the questions, probably due to morning schedule and everyone is sleepy lol.
reviews.comment_grading:
Examination I                - 20% (80 points)
Examination II               - 30% (120 points)
Group project               - 30% (120 points)
Class participation        - 14% (56 points)
Research participation  - 6% (24 points)

Examination I (midterms) is MCQ and it's not that hard if you study the concepts in the textbook thoroughly. Examination II (final) is essay writing and one cheat sheet is allowed for the exam. Final is non-cumulative covering the second part of course. Group project is a disaster if you have free riders in the group, it is divided into two parts, written report (15%) and presentation (15%). Participation is basically attendance and some group activities.

The final grade is rather disappointing tho. I scored 1.2SD higher in midterms and participated in class actively but end up only B+. I emailed Prof. Chao and the TA regarding the grade and the reason is that I did badly for my final short essays even though my marks for midterm, long essay and participation are above average. So probably everyone is good in the examination and the curve is steep :O (Guess this is the norm of business school?)
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is actually okay. It really depends on your group members as some groups with good chemistry can work out but as in my case, I did most parts of my group project (contributing ideas, structures, write-up etc) report so it almost killed me especially there were few other projects on-going in the semester lol.

reviews.author: Dreamscometrue
reviews.comment_content:
Course on Organizational Behavior:

Personality and values
Emotions and moods
Perception
Communication
Motivation
Leadership and power
Conflicts and negotiation
Group behaviours and workteams

A good course for you to understand yourself, and how individuals will affect an organization. You can really try to use the concepts learnt in daily lives. Great course for me.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lucia is a really good professor with advanced presentation skills, she is able to present all the materials clearly and interestingly, and engage all of the students in the lecture. She remembers all of her students' name and she can name you when you ask/answer questions. She cares about students a lot and will ask us questions like how do you feel or how can I make you feel better... She is also very kind and willing to answer your questions, both in the lecture and after the lecture.

In the lecture, she encourages us to speak and participate in class, so we had many inclass group discussion. It is really a relaxing but informative class.

If you can, choose her lecture, I think this will be a good choice for most students.
reviews.comment_grading:
She has high demand in the presentation (groups mostly getting only average marks, you can only score a 4 or above in a 5-point scale if you perform really well). BUT, in terms of final grading, she is very lenient.

The final exam is crucial to get a good grade, as the marks of us for previous exams and assignments are packed tightly.

Heard that people who score below mean for 2SD in mid-term with fair performance in project and final can still secure a B-.

The mean of her lectures may be B or even higher.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy.

1 midterm with 60+ MCQs, the questions are not easy
1 final with 4 SQs and 1 essay, not easy either
1 group project: analyzing a movie with OB concepts
Individual participation: PRS questions in each lectures
Group participation: fill in a form with the names of all groupmates if they all present, then you will get the marks
Research participation: easy, just online questionnaire

Good that we don't have to collect cards or raise hand continuously to get the participation points, but still, many students will ask and answer questions. Contribute more to the class will benefit all of you.

reviews.author: Corazon
reviews.comment_content:
The project ( analyse a movie with OB concepts) - take more time to deal with it
stay with good group members always :)))))
concepts introduced in class are relatively easy, especially if you have studied BAFS (management) before
reviews.comment_teaching: lots of discussion in class, which will be tested in exams
reviews.comment_grading:
presentation - raja gives similar grades to the presentation, he likes creative stuff
midterm - MCs
final - MC + questions (choose 2 from 3), this determines your grade mostly
the project, especially the presentation take a lot of % in the final grade. Instead of introducing the content, making it more fun and interesting is much more important. the bonus (~5 marks) given to the best presenting group does not matter actually
reviews.comment_workload: fair, group project

reviews.author: kayyangrace
reviews.title: GOOD GRADE
reviews.comment_content:
group project: 40%
final: 25%
midterm: 15%
attendance: 14%
management research: 6%
佢final佔得唔算多比起其他班
reviews.comment_teaching:
呢個prof take attendance既方法係上堂答問題，每堂只可以答一題而滿分係10題。其中會有3堂係present一定要番因為佢計attendance。
佢好中意考上堂野基本上走一走堂已經miss左野，上堂播片會係midterm and final考番，所以基本上走堂都預左爛grade。
我覺得佢上堂唔算悶可能自己都幾中意d內容，同埋都唔敢訓啦佢考好多上堂野。
reviews.comment_grading:
只要答足問題，唔freeride基本上都會好grade。
my grade: A
(2 of my groupmates got A range also)
reviews.comment_workload:
1 midterm, 1 final, 1 project with presentation
group project係做個movie review既野，分析下套戲有咩ob issue，基本上佢冇理過我地既project只係臨完sem前present加個final report計分。佢有兩次peer evaluation，所以應該少d人敢freeride。
我覺得最chur都係上堂要答問題先有得take attendance因為聽講gbus果班係好多人都好中意答問題。冇乜readings睇。

reviews.author: Samo
reviews.title: Interesting and Realistic Course
reviews.comment_content:
I came in to this class not expecting to like it, but it turns out I was wrong.

Course content is very realistic, and the professor will do his utmost best to prove that to you, using experiments, cases, etc.

The course is borderline intro to psych, and goes through aspects such as behavior, personality, value systems, group and individual decision making, team processes, leadership, communication, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Raja has been one of my best professors thus far in HKUST. He puts in real effort into all of his lectures, meticulously planning how to ensure maximum knowledge retention.

Structure of most classes is quite similar, in the sense that he begins with a PowerPoint and some theories, then goes on to show you a couple videos about the same / a case / group exercise, and then finishes it off with takeaways. His teaching is very structured.
reviews.comment_grading:
Since it's a fairly easy course, and he allows cheatsheets for the exams, the course means are generally quite high.

Participation in Class 14%: You get one card for every time you answer a question in class, and 10 cards usually means you will get perfect score.

Research Participation 6%: Department policy, attend 3 studies, and receive the points.

Midterm 15%: MCQ based midterm, based solely of what he has gone through in class [if he didn't cover it in class, you don't have to study it]. Midterm has a high mean, it was around 82% for my class.

Assignment 40% (20% presentation, 16% report, 4% progress report: Need to select a movie and analyze the OB theories within it, and present findings. Progress report is a simple 1 page report that you submit a month into the course, then you do a presentation to the whole class, and also prepare a comprehensive report of your findings.
*Innovativeness and creativity will be rewarded in your presentations.
**Class vote at the end of each day of presentation ,and winner receives bonus marks.

Final Exam 25%: Non cumulative exam, semi MCQ, semi essay based. Similar comment to the Midterm.

- About the exams, it is vital that you attend classes, and take part actively in the cases and experiments. Questions about these come up very regularly in his exams, as he is an avid believer in the takeaways/conclusions, as opposed to the theories themselves.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not heavy at all if you manage your time and your group effectively.

Straightforward course, and if you do what he asks, you should do well.

reviews.author: JoyceYip
reviews.comment_content: The content is relatively easier than other subjects, since some of the contents usually applied to real life. Also, the depth of content is not much needed.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her English is not bad to listen to, some Chinese accent but is ok. She encourages students to participate in class a lot.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading of this course is ok. Midterms and finals are easy so the mean and median are quite high. The grading also contains group project, which separated into few parts: presentation, essay, progress review
mean = B+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fine, considered as a business required course.

reviews.author: IT
reviews.comment_content: I think it is not that useful, he teaches some theories of decision making in individual, team and group level.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His class is relaxing, he uses good and real life examples to illustrate the theory.
There will be some group work sometimes.
reviews.comment_grading:
I don't think the grade is too good.
I got below mean in the mid-term, I think our project is fair, and finally I got a C+.
You have to get some participation cards in order to gain the participation mark.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload.
Need little effort in the project when the deadline is approaching.

reviews.author: uni
reviews.comment_content: management seems to be so vague and sometimes you don't really understand what you are studying. There are many concepts and models that try to complicate the whole thinking process. So better revise your note after lesson or ask Raja if you find some parts difficult to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: Raja is very nice. He doesn't want you to send him email asking the same question as your classmates so better ask questions during lesson or after lesson. He will use some meaningful example in class in order to illustrate different management concepts and theories. There are plenty of cases to be discussed in class and all these cases are very important since all would be examined. Please remember to read all the cases again and try to get famailiar with them.
reviews.comment_grading:
fair.
you could get 1 double-page cheat sheet for your mid-term and final exam. mid-term exam consists of 35 mc questions and this is not really difficult. many cases discussed in class are examined.
for final exam, there are mc and long questions. time is quite limited and you have to write faster for your essay otherwise you can't finish the paper.
you have to participate in three experients and gain 6% of participation marks.
your project will count 40% towards your final grade so you have to prepare well for your final report and presentation.
reviews.comment_workload:
this course has not much workload except those days preparing for the group project since you only have to attend the lessons and try to get as much participation cards as possible by answering questions from professor.
i suggest you to prepare your group project according to your plan. Don't do it in the last minute otheriwse you will find your group in trouble esaily. After submitting the final report of your group project, you will have a short presentation (around 12 minutes) and you'd better present it in a creative way.

reviews.author: Astor
reviews.title: Good professor and interesting topic
reviews.comment_content: I think it relates to psychology a lot and I enjoy the lesson very much. Especially for the experimental learning, it is interesting and it is highly recommended not be absent from it as midterm and final will ask about it!
reviews.comment_teaching: He has a heavy Japanese accent but if you listen more, you will find it ok. He always talks his experience or plays movie clips, which is not directly related to the lesson. But I find it quite interesting and gives me very deep impression.
reviews.comment_grading: Final exam is open book! I think this will increase the mean and lower the SD and competitiveness increases among the students!
reviews.comment_workload: Project is one of the lesson's concern. This professor can let us choose our own movie and provide different time slot for us to ask him questions. Progress report, presentation and final report is needed.

reviews.author: ykal
reviews.comment_content:

reviews.author: Kevin
reviews.comment_content: Treat it as a business version of psychology. If you love psychology,  you will rock in this course. If you hate it, good luck!!
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is generally fair. As she's a local professor, her English level was more competent than other UST professors. She's able to present the content in an interactive way, but sometimes it may be annoying as you need to do well in classes to get the 'participation' cards.
reviews.comment_grading: Melody Chao is a generous professor in-terms of grading. Personally, I scored below mean in Final Exam, above median/mean in Project, probably but not sure whether I am above average or not in Final. In return, she gave me an A for the course's letter grade. You may always talk to her if you have any inquiries towards your grades, and she is generally very responsive to students' emails.
reviews.comment_workload: This course is a compulsory course for business students, so the course workload may be a little overwhelming. You have to work on a Research project on organizational behavior.

reviews.author: V.lylit
reviews.title: More like Psychology 101
reviews.comment_content:
Some topics: personalities, leadership, teamwork, decision-making, emotions, conflicts (esp handling style)
* Not in chronological order
reviews.comment_teaching:
He does a lot of talking and referring to powerpoints that apparently weren't made by him(?). The best thing about his class, though, is that he gives a lot of chances for the class to participate, whether vocally (in class) or online. That facilitates learning a lot, especially as people have different perceptions of the same thing.

Sometimes, you will see his wife coning to class as a guest. (How sweet)

PS Sometimes he may not be able to comprehend your points - and hence he may end up distorting your meaning. (Happened to me a few times ,_, )
reviews.comment_grading:
Disclaimer: I got an A, so treat this part with a pinch of salt.

Exams: mostly MCQs, but there are essay questions in the final exam. Be careful: the seemingly unimportant in-class experiment/exercise that you missed could end up as an essay question...

Project: there were 4 options, all broad topics. After choosing one of them, your group should come up with a reasonably specific question. And then work on it. Finally give a presentation and report about the topic. Tip: remember to consult your prof - 1. You can let him recognize you, 2. You can get to know his preference. Just ask him indirectly - he's nice enough to tell you a lot more than you need ;)
I didn't meet anyone that free-rides or doesn't cooperate well - but if you do, make sure you keep your evidence (in case you end up reporting...)

Participation:
1. Be present (and sign up) for in-class experiments.
2. Make hin recognize you by always bringing your name tag to class, and answering enough questions to earn you 2 participation cards every class*. Otherwise, you can ask him questions or go to online discussions. Better still, initiate discussions there :)
* that's what I did, but you don't have to - he will remind you of how the parti scores are calculated, and you'll realise that it's helpful but not necessary.
reviews.comment_workload: Well... you have a midterm, a final exam, and a project (presentation and report). The load isn't exactly light. (Duh)

reviews.comment_teaching: He is quite funny professor which is indeed a local person. You will have no difficulties understanding his teaching and he always telljokes in the lesson.

His final exam is splited into 5 parts.

reviews.author: uhmbye
reviews.title: Super nice professor
reviews.comment_content:
Won't go over the syllabus as everyone else has talked about it.

You can't choose your own groupmates so it really depends on luck.
reviews.comment_teaching: Martha is super nice, her classes are super interactive and she really tries to make sure you understand the concepts through case studies, games, and examples. She really tries to give everyone a chance to get participation points so don't worry about that.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grading in my opinion,

Midterm 20% (69/70, mean 59.7 sd 7.1)
Final 30% (non-cumulative) (not released)
Team Project 30% (not released)
Class Participation 14% (not released)
Research 6% (just do surveys)

Final grade: A+

Midterm was open book so it was fairly easy, as long as you understand the concepts you will do well, only MCs. The final exam was 5-6 (I don't rmb) short answer questions, time was quite tight as you had to write around 1700 words in an hour but as long as you refer to course concepts and TYPE QUICKLY you will be fine.

You can only answer one question per class as Martha is big on giving everyone a chance to answer, classes that record attendance are announced in the syllabus so you don't have to attend all classes if you don't want to.

Martha loves creative presentations like dramas or anything funny, so put in more effort into making your presentation fun and you'll be fine.

Lots of opportunities for easy extra credit.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fair, as long as you show up to classes you don't even have to study much for the exams. In the project you have to find OB issues in movies and give solutions for them, all you have to do is hand in a 5 page progress report, 10 page final report and 15 minute presentation. Choose a good movie and it will be easy to finish, hope and pray for good groupmates lmao.

reviews.comment_content: Quite useless. This courses try to equip you with some skills to manage people when you are working a few years later. Should I point out which experiment provided which evidence to mange which kind of person when I am in the workplace? The exam is set pretty ludicrous. When you are in this course, you are expecting learn some skills to solve some situation. This can be examined by the exam. But the exam ask what obstacles we face during the group project. FUNNY!
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is just reading everything included in the slides.
reviews.comment_grading:
Try to get into a group with some normal classmates. There are some people which I have never met, and we were randomly arranged into the same group. In a group of 7 to 8, one irresponsible group mate can ruin the game. Avoid pointing out the gender of that "great" group mate, I will use he/she. He/she said he/she does not know how to add point form in the slides! That's the reason for him/her to free ride. Learnt something, guys? Being a university student, not only does he/she free ride in drafting the slides, but also free ride in presenting,

But, never expect the peer evaluation system works. He/she will just receive a score which is 1 to 2 marks lower than yours.

reviews.comment_content:
Content is typically easy and mostly from the slides.
Course Materials
Required materials
• Required textbook: Robbins, Stephen P., & Judge, Timothy A. 2018. Organizational Behavior, 18th
edition (Global edition). Harlow, Essex, England: Pearson Education Limited. Limited copies are
available for 2-hour loan from the Library Course Reserve (under MGMT2110).
Additional resources
Lecture notes: will be available for download from the course website before each class. These are just
outlines and not meant to replace the textbook and your own note-taking.
• Additional handouts will be distributed on the course website or in class periodically.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I highly recommend attending her lectures as her slides are incomplete and she mentions the unfilled blanks in the slides during class. Class time will be divided between lectures, experiential exercises, videos, discussions, and student
presentations. It will take our collective efforts – students and hers – to make this course interesting,
challenging, thought-provoking, interactive, and fun!

Some tips-
Come to class on time. If you are late, go sit in the last row with minimal disturbance to the class. If
the last row is full, you will have to leave the classroom.
• Turn off the ringer of your mobile phones.
• Electronic devices (Laptops/Tablets/etc.) are not permitted in class.
• Listen attentively and participate actively to contribute to the classroom learning environment

reviews.author: Klkm
reviews.comment_content:
This course will cover the following topics and they are straightforward.
Personality and values
Emotions and moods
Perception and decision Processes
Communication
The Basics of motivation
Leadership and power
Conflict and negotiation
reviews.comment_teaching: Lucia is very nice. Discussion is included during the lecture. Lecture notes are provided before the lecture but a bit general. So it's better to read the reference book for better understanding.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is very good. It's easy to get a B grade or above. Of course the more effort you devote, the better grade you deserve.

•Examination I MC 20%
•Examination II ESSAY 30%
•Team project 30%
•Class participation 14%
•Research participation 6%
•Total 100%
reviews.comment_workload: This course is not demanding. There's only MC questions for midterm exam but a bit tricky. For the final exam, short questions and an essay question are included. For class participation, it splits into individual participation and team participation. There are about 5 PRS questions for most of the lectures. Answer them correctly and you will get the individual participation mark. For team participation, simply attend every lectures with your groupmates and sign the team participation sheet to identify the whole team is attending the lecture. Of course the good groupmates are necessary so you won't lose the mark.

reviews.author: lapin1004
reviews.comment_content: the content focuses on breaking down human behaviors in team/group settings and managerial implications to resolve issues in business organization setting. Mostly straightforward and some memorization required.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Andre WAI is a good professor. He tries to engage students in his class and he greatly values participation.
He is willing to answer all questions in class and enjoys communicating with students about class contents. Tries to make the content less boring than what it can be.

His teaching consists of lectures, questions, mini group activities/games in class, and videos.

Although he made some cultural remarks that weren't quite understandable to a certain point - but wasn't too offensive or unacceptable. Plus, wish he'd just assigned us the Youtube video to watch at home not in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
participation 14
midterm(all MCQ) 25
final(all long answer) 25
group project 30
research participation(survey) 6

not too strict, think it is fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not a lot - need to attend all lectures in person to earn attendance and participate in class to earn participation points.

The team project can take some time, but most of it is analyzing individual behaviors in group setting from a movie - writing a report and presenting a ppt to your class.
Workload depends on your group members combined effort.

reviews.author: imahitman
reviews.comment_content: Relatively useful content and interesting enough. If you're interested in psychology or just understanding organizations better you would probably be interested in the content.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Terrible teaching.
She tries to make it interactive but she uses ways to teach 5 year olds.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term - 20% (80 marks)
Final - 30% (120 marks)
Group project - 30% (120 marks)
Class participation - 14% (56 marks)
Research participation - 6% (24 marks)

Relatively fair grading scheme.
Class participation is recorded with a group task every class and you just need to write your name down on that. Just become friend with your groupmates and tell them to help you out.
reviews.comment_workload: If you do not attend the lectures you will probably find it hard to understand the lecture notes because she covers the information with white boxes during her presentation but then uploads a PDF file which basically just blocks everything. I even tried to email her to send me the PPT but she claims it was my fault for not note-taking..

reviews.author: Doug Stamper
reviews.title: 一個唔知做乜勁既course
reviews.comment_content:
是咁的，簡單啲黎講，將唔少商業上既常識抄埋一碟既course
例如當成組人都同意一樣野個陣，一個人唔係好敢做相反既決定，又或者係接收資訊個陣人會傾向睇一啲自己認同既野而唔係客觀既事車啦...
reviews.comment_teaching:
一個字，悶
真心其實上佢堂係聽書，然後偶爾會有啲小組活動或者上下天台不過唔係學丁蟹咁自殺而係做啲實驗例如分組用報紙起樓咁...
佢把聲就有小小悶....
總之悶啦
reviews.comment_grading:
呢個係一個考驗你背野既course
啫係呢個course有mid-term同final，mid-term有七十條MC，然後叫你背七八個PPT，然後個mean又試高到痴線
好啦，去到final就係鬥吹水同背野既時候啦，例如背下接收資訊有邊四樣bias，又或者係叫你sello個爛左既生果咁
跟住又有份group project，睇組員啦，不過肯做野又如何，每次個mean又係高到痴線，final report有39/40以為好高啦，點知個mean係39.4........
佢又唔會好明顯咁take attendance，不過有時啲class activities就係要寫你自己個ID同名，可能佢係咁take attendance啦.....
你話MGMT course要答問題? 查實我都唔知答左幾多
但係總結就係我唔知點解左個A....
再總結，呢個course就係一個唔知做乜勁既course，考試前要背野，跟住啲mean又高到一個點，但係明明自己每次assessment又唔係高mean幾個SD但又攞A....
所以我都唔識評佢個grade究竟爛唔爛....
我既意見? 好簡單，讀BSC就避左呢個course啦....
reviews.comment_workload:
那那那，佢實叫你睇書架.
第一堂我有睇E-BOOK，睇左第一版就冇再睇
見過有人仲買埋本書，但係我想講，無論你點背，背點你論無，你MC同final都可以唔使用書，用左亦無特別優勢，因為PPT已經可以砌死你.....
所以，除左考之前個晚，根本可以係0 workload...

reviews.author: BBC
reviews.title: Quite an easy course with fair grading
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite interesting, mainly about psychology stuff, talks about interesting psychological experiments and group interaction, but the structure of the PowerPoint is not done very well.

For content under the same concept, sometimes they are put into different slides with some other irrelevant stuff in between them, and then I need to jump back and forth to re-organise them.

In this case, making your own notes are important for the exam because you can fix the structure of the content and collect the pieces back to a coherent whole for fast reference.

Content:

1. Introduction to Organizational Behavior
2. Personality and Values
3. Perception and Learning I
4. Perception and Learning II
5. Emotions and Job Attitudes
6. Emotional Labor & Stress
7. Motivation I
8. Motivation II & Performance

----- Mid-term

9. Team Dynamics I
10. Team Dynamics II
11. Communication & Conflict Management
12. Leadership, Power, & Influence I
13. Leadership, Power, & Influence II

---- Final exam
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good professor, quite responsive and quite nice.

The only issue is that the PowerPoint is not structured well,  which makes it necessary to make notes by myself for quick reference in exams.

You would not have enough time to find the relevant materials in the PPT if you search for them during the exam, partly because there is not much time and partly because the relevant materials are scattered around.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term Exam: 20%
Final Exam: 30%
Class Participation: 14%
Research Participation: 6%
Team Project: 30%
(2.5% progress report + 12.5% presentation + 10% Final report + 5% peer evaluation)

The mid-term exam is half MC half essay, with 35 MC questions and 2 essay questions in 1 hour.

The final exam is all essay questions, covering all materials in the course (but mainly the second half), and 4 essay questions in 1 hour.

Class participation is answering questions in class, research participation is just free scores by participation in online questionnaires.

The team project is assessing a movie and finding out what is the issues with organisational behaviour and the psychology of the characters of the movie.

Mid-term:
Mean = 139.07 / 200
SD= 22.03
My score: 194.4 / 200

Final:
Mean = 209 / 300
SD = 37.6
My score: 300 / 300

Final Report:
Mean = 60.8 / 100
SD = 15
My score: 85 / 100

Participation:
Mean = 105 / 140
SD = 28.3
My score: 140 / 140

Overall grade: A+

I would say the grading is fair enough.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much.

Need to prepare for the exams and make notes though. During the exam the time is quite tight, I finished both exams just on time (being a fast typer). I guess most of the other people could not finish them within one hour.

Besides that, the group project also needs some time to handle, maybe some more group meetings and stuff, but overall the workload is not as much as the other courses I encountered, it is a pretty simple course.
